ZGORGET
Echarpe de bataille du Zhentarim
Manshoon du Zhentarim ne retirait jamais un objet, son écharpe de bataille, un collier de lamelles superposées qui protégeait sa gorge. Elle fut faite pour arrêter les attaques à la gorge et les assassinats rapides et s'avéra très précieuse car les tentatives étaient fréquentes. Le collier protège aussi le porteur des attaques d'armes perforantes d'une manière générale.

PARAMETRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
  Une fois par jour pendant 4 rounds, le porteur peut devenir quasiment immunisé aux attaques sournoises car 95% d'entre elles passent alors au travers du porteur grâce à un enchantement magique de l'objet
  Une fois par jour, le porteur peut provoquer la pression sur une cible d'une masse de 300 kg ou plus. Elle doit réussir un jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts sous peine d'être ralentie pendant 5 rounds et vulnérable à la volonté du porteur
  Le porteur peut, une fois par jour, créer une vague répulsive dans une zone. Ceux qui ratent leur jet de sauvegarde sont repoussés et fuient pendant 6 rounds
  Protection contre la mort instantanée

Bonus à la Classe d'Armure : +1
Poids : 1
Utilisable par :
 Mage
Manshoon du Zhentarim ne retirait jamais un objet, son écharpe de bataille, un collier de lamelles superposées qui protégeait sa gorge. Elle fut faite pour arrêter les attaques à la gorge et les assassinats rapides et s'avéra très précieuse car les tentatives étaient fréquentes. Le collier protège aussi le porteur des attaques d'armes perforantes d'une manière générale.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Immunité à la mort magique

Capacités de charge : 
- Classe d'armure : +100 contre les armes perforantes pendant 4 rounds (1 fois par jour)
- Inflige lenteur à la cible pendant 5 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre les sorts pour éviter) (1 fois par jour)
- Inflige Horreur à la cible pendant 6 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre la pétrification et la métamorphose pour éviter) (1 fois par jour)

Poids : 1

ZLIN118

ZLIN135
Ogre Club
Ogre Club

The Ogre Club is a common weapon for an Ogre. Clubs are stout, hardwood sticks, narrow at the grip and wider at the end.  This simple weapon has been used since mankind first began using tools.  Anyone can find a good stout piece of wood and swing it; hence the club's widespread use.

STATISTICS

Damage type:  blunt
Weight: 10

On the other side of the bridge were two huge lions that promised to make short work of anyone who attempted to cross, but the ring revealed them to be nothing more than illusions.

ZLIN139
Hide of the Nemean Lion
Hide of the Nemean Lion

The Nemean Lion was the offspring of Typhon and Echidna. It was a vicious beast with an impenetrable hide that ravaged the countryside around Nemea. King Eurystheus ordered Heracles to slay the beast and return with its hide as the first of twelve labors.
Heracles stalked the creature well into the afternoon, until he finally came upon it unnoticed. He fired two arrows at the beast, but the impenetrable hide turned them away harmlessly. The lion charged Heracles, who struck it in the head with his mighty olive-wood club. The club shattered, but the blow managed to daze the lion long enough for him to grab the lion by the throat and choke the life out of it.
Nothing in Heracles' possession was strong enough to skin the hide, so he used the Nemean Lion's own claws. He wore the hide as a cloak, which granted him the same protection as its previous owner.
Hide of the Nemean Lion

The Nemean Lion was the offspring of Typhon and Echidna. It was a vicious beast with an impenetrable hide that ravaged the countryside around Nemea. King Eurystheus ordered Heracles to slay the beast and return with its hide as the first of twelve labors.
Heracles stalked the creature well into the afternoon, until he finally came upon it unnoticed. He fired two arrows at the beast, but the impenetrable hide turned them away harmlessly. The lion charged Heracles, who struck it in the head with his mighty olive-wood club. The club shattered, but the blow managed to daze the lion long enough for him to grab the lion by the throat and choke the life out of it.
Nothing in Heracles' possession was strong enough to skin the hide, so he used the Nemean Lion's own claws. He wore the hide as a cloak, which granted him the same protection as its previous owner.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Jets de sauvegarde : +2
- Immunité contre les armes enchantées +2
- Immunité contre les armes non-magiques

Poids : 3


ZLIN140
Athame Keris
Athame Keris

An athame keris is a ceremonial dagger, one of several magical tools used in neopagan religions and other Witchcraft traditions. The creation is a long and complicated Magical ritual which involves the blending of the metal with magickal ingredients and the invoking of a powerful jinn/khodam spirit into the keris Blade. What gives the keris its power is the genie( Also known as Khodam or Jinn) that resides in it. The genie, or jinn, is a magickal spirit that normally exists in a parallel dimension. The performance of complex rituals can draw one across the threshold and encourage it to make its home in a magically prepared object. After the athame keris has been created, the spirit is continually fed, so it gradually grows more powerful. They are often passed down from generation to generation.
Athame Keris

An athame keris is a ceremonial dagger, one of several magical tools used in neopagan religions and other Witchcraft traditions. The creation is a long and complicated Magical ritual which involves the blending of the metal with magickal ingredients and the invoking of a powerful jinn/khodam spirit into the keris Blade. What gives the keris its power is the genie( Also known as Khodam or Jinn) that resides in it. The genie, or jinn, is a magickal spirit that normally exists in a parallel dimension. The performance of complex rituals can draw one across the threshold and encourage it to make its home in a magically prepared object. After the athame keris has been created, the spirit is continually fed, so it gradually grows more powerful. They are often passed down from generation to generation.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Résistance au feu : +50 %
- Résistance au froid : Multiplié par 80 %
- Résistance à l'électricité : Multiplié par 80 %
- Résistance à l'acide : Multiplié par 80 %
- Bénédiction
- Permet de lancer plusieurs sorts par round
- 65 % de chance d'augmenter de 50 % la rsistance aux dgts de feu magiques du porteur pendant 6 rounds

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d6 +1
Type de dégâts : Perforant / Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 0
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0


ZLIN142
Joyeuse
Joyeuse

Created and given to him by an angel, the Joyeuse was Charlemagne's personal sword. The name translates as "joyful". Some legends claim that it was forged to contain the Lance of Longinus within its pommel—others state it was supposedly smithed from the same materials as Roland's Durendal and Ogier's Curtana.

STATISTICS

Damage:  1D8+2
Damage type:  Slash
Weight: 3
Speed Factor: 2
Special:
+1 strength bonus
+1 constitution bonus
+2 Intelligence bonus
Blessed while equipped
Immune to disease while equipped
Removes curses

ZLIN148
Enchanted Shuriken
Enchanted Shuriken

Shuriken means, "sword hidden in the hand", they are also commonly known as "death stars", "throwing stars" or "ninja stars". They are sharpened hand-held blades made from a variety of everyday items such as needles, nails, and knives, as well as coins, washers, and other flat plates of metal.
Enchanted Shuriken

Shuriken means, "sword hidden in the hand", they are also commonly known as "death stars", "throwing stars" or "ninja stars". They are sharpened hand-held blades made from a variety of everyday items such as needles, nails, and knives, as well as coins, washers, and other flat plates of metal.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à 2

Dégâts : 1d6 
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 1
Type de compétence : Dague
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 3

ZLIN153
Balmung
Balmung

A magical sword, the Balmung was made by Wayland the Smith. Odin stabbed the Branstock tree, an oak tree in the Volsung palace, with Balmung. Odin then said that he who could pull the sword from the tree is destined to win in battle. Nine of the Volsung princes tried to take the sword, but only the youngest ever got it out. His name was Sigmund. Odin destroyed Balmung in battle but it was reassembled and Siegfried later used it against Fafnir. After it was reforged, it could cleave an anvil in twain.
Balmung

A magical sword, the Balmung was made by Wayland the Smith. Odin stabbed the Branstock tree, an oak tree in the Volsung palace, with Balmung. Odin then said that he who could pull the sword from the tree is destined to win in battle. Nine of the Volsung princes tried to take the sword, but only the youngest ever got it out. His name was Sigmund. Odin destroyed Balmung in battle but it was reassembled and Siegfried later used it against Fafnir. After it was reforged, it could cleave an anvil in twain.

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d8 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 3
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0

Nécessite : 
- Force : 6


ZLIN154
Aladdin's Ring
Aladdin's Ring

This is the magic ring that the famous thief Aladdin used to summon the Genie. He later lost it and it was found by King Solomon to gain wisdom and powers. It is claimed that the demon Sakhr deceived one of Solomon's sisters into giving him the ring. Sakhr then ruled in his stead for forty years, while Solomon wandered the country in poverty. However eventually Sakhr threw the ring into the sea, where it was swallowed by a fish, caught by a fisherman, and served to Solomon. Solomon used the power of the ring to turn back time and used the knowledge he had gained to make him the wisest of all kings
Aladdin's Ring

This is the magic ring that the famous thief Aladdin used to summon the Genie. He later lost it and it was found by King Solomon to gain wisdom and powers. It is claimed that the demon Sakhr deceived one of Solomon's sisters into giving him the ring. Sakhr then ruled in his stead for forty years, while Solomon wandered the country in poverty. However eventually Sakhr threw the ring into the sea, where it was swallowed by a fish, caught by a fisherman, and served to Solomon. Solomon used the power of the ring to turn back time and used the knowledge he had gained to make him the wisest of all kings

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +2

ZLIN186
Triple-Bladed Sly Sword
Triple-Bladed Sly Sword

The Sly Sword is a unique weapon. It is, by all appearances, an over-wrought sword with a large central blade, ornate quillions, and two smaller outer blades. However, it's appearance is deceiving. By using compressed air, it can fire two of the blades and impale opponents at a distance. Each of the peripheral blades can be "fired" with the same range as a crossbow bolt, into seperate targets.
Triple-Bladed Sly Sword

The Sly Sword is a unique weapon. It is, by all appearances, an over-wrought sword with a large central blade, ornate quillions, and two smaller outer blades. However, it's appearance is deceiving. By using compressed air, it can fire two of the blades and impale opponents at a distance. Each of the peripheral blades can be "fired" with the same range as a crossbow bolt, into seperate targets.

Capacités de charge : 
- Inflige 3d6 points de dégâts tranchants à la cible (2 fois par jour)

ZLIN191

Dragon Scale Cloak

The scales of a dragon have been woven into the cloak, creating formidable protection from normal weapon,  as well as fire, cold, and electricity elements. In addition, powerful magical enchantments have been cast on this cloak to help protect the wearer from many of the dangerous Dragon attacks.

STATISTICS

Special: Wearer is immune to the effects of Wing Buffet by dragons
Bonuses: Sets fire, cold and electrical resistance to 25%
Armor Class: +1 bonus
Saving Throw vs. Breath: +6 bonus
Weight: 2
Dragon Scale Cloak

The scales of a dragon have been woven into the cloak, creating formidable protection from normal weapon,  as well as fire, cold, and electricity elements. In addition, powerful magical enchantments have been cast on this cloak to help protect the wearer from many of the dangerous Dragon attacks.

ZLIN192
Vorpal Sword
Vorpal Sword

This swords is capable of beheading the Jabberwock and sometimes other creatures. 

    "One, two! One, two! And through and through
    The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
    He left it dead, and with its head
    He went galumphing back." 

Lewis Carroll

STATISTICS

THAC0: +4 bonus
Damage:  1D8+4
Damage type:  Slash
Weight: 4
Speed Factor: 1
Special: Decapitate enemies.
Vorpal Sword

This swords is capable of beheading the Jabberwock and sometimes other creatures. 

    "One, two! One, two! And through and through
    The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
    He left it dead, and with its head
    He went galumphing back." 

Lewis Carroll

PARAMÈTRES :

- Dextérité : +1
- Résistance à la magie : +75 %

- 36 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 26 % de chance de tuer instantanément les  (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 6 % de chance de tuer instantanément les

ZLIN197
Sword of the Lich King
Sword of the Lich King

Nagash was a priest in the courts of the land of Nehekara, and after learning Dark Magic from prisoner Dark Elves, developed his own twisted form of Magic which he termed Necromancy. This magic gave him the power to command the dead, and ultimately he cast a powerful spell from his tower, with the intent of raising all the dead of Nehekhara, thus creating a titanic army of mindless Undead. This was the unholy weapon that the Lich King forged for himself to use in battle.

ZLIN201
Leiomano
Leiomano

This weapon uses wood, cord, and shark teeth. Shark teeth fastened in place with a twine of sorts. And while shark teeth are great for ripping up soft flesh, they would not survive an impact with a hard place, much less the leather thong or twine holding it in place. The teeth are aligned just right so that any blow from this, glancing, pulling, cleaving, etc would almost certainly draw blood. And while it might not be as effective as a sword, you better believe that a battle with combatants taking repeated hits from this would get torn to shreds and bleed to death.

And if you take into account that the heavy wooden head could probably deliver pretty hefty blows all by itself, even without the benefit of shark teeth, you can see how this would make for a very effective melee weapon.

STATISTICS:

THACO:  +3 bonus
Damage:  1D6 +3
Damage type piercing
Weight: 3 
Speed Factor: 4
Type:  1-handed
Requires: 5 Strength
5 Dexterity
Leiomano

This weapon uses wood, cord, and shark teeth. Shark teeth fastened in place with a twine of sorts. And while shark teeth are great for ripping up soft flesh, they would not survive an impact with a hard place, much less the leather thong or twine holding it in place. The teeth are aligned just right so that any blow from this, glancing, pulling, cleaving, etc would almost certainly draw blood. And while it might not be as effective as a sword, you better believe that a battle with combatants taking repeated hits from this would get torn to shreds and bleed to death.

And if you take into account that the heavy wooden head could probably deliver pretty hefty blows all by itself, even without the benefit of shark teeth, you can see how this would make for a very effective melee weapon.

PARAMÈTRES : 

TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d6 +3
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : Gourdin
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 3

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5
- Dextérité : 5


ZLIN202
Mere Pounamu
Mere Pounamu

A mere is a short club normally made of a heavy hardwood or stone, such as jade. Shaped like a short paddle and broad and flat at the striking end and with a maximum of two or three grooves on the handle end which also had a hole to allow a wrist-cord to be attached. Due to its hardness, the greenstone mere was always ground much more thinly than those of whalebone or stone and when held against the light, the thin edges have a translucent glow, making a beautiful and also fearsome weapon. Of all the short weapons made of wood stone or bone, the mere pounamu was held in the highest regard. Ancient mere were often carved from the prized inanga variety of jade. Mere vary in length but are generally around 30 cm (12 inches) in length. Mere have two almost flat sides and a rounded, sharpened top. hese were symbols of chieftainship and passed down as valuable heirlooms. Traditionally individual mere are named, and each is said to possess a spirit of its own.

A warrior would use the club in either hand, wielding it like a cleaver with a slicing motion to strike at an adversary's head or neck. When not in use, the mere was carried tucked into the folds of the user's belt, safe yet always at hand.

STATISTICS:
Special: Can kill with a single blow and sometimes knocks enemies unconscious
THACO:  +1 bonus
Damage:  1D6 +1
Damage type piercing
Weight: 3 
Speed Factor: 4
Type:  1-handed
Requires: 5 Strength
Mere Pounamu

A mere is a short club normally made of a heavy hardwood or stone, such as jade. Shaped like a short paddle and broad and flat at the striking end and with a maximum of two or three grooves on the handle end which also had a hole to allow a wrist-cord to be attached. Due to its hardness, the greenstone mere was always ground much more thinly than those of whalebone or stone and when held against the light, the thin edges have a translucent glow, making a beautiful and also fearsome weapon. Of all the short weapons made of wood stone or bone, the mere pounamu was held in the highest regard. Ancient mere were often carved from the prized inanga variety of jade. Mere vary in length but are generally around 30 cm (12 inches) in length. Mere have two almost flat sides and a rounded, sharpened top. hese were symbols of chieftainship and passed down as valuable heirlooms. Traditionally individual mere are named, and each is said to possess a spirit of its own.

A warrior would use the club in either hand, wielding it like a cleaver with a slicing motion to strike at an adversary's head or neck. When not in use, the mere was carried tucked into the folds of the user's belt, safe yet always at hand.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités de combat : 
- 26 % de chance d'endormir la cible de manière permanente (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 2 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible

TAC0 : +1
Dégâts : 1d6 +1
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 4
Type de compétence : Gourdin
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 3

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5


ZLIN203
Macuahuitl
Macuahuitl

The "hungry-wood", is essentially a wooden sword with sharp prismatic obsidian blades embedded into its sides. A blow from such a weapon was reputedly capable of decapitating a horse. Although it is sometimes referred to as a sword or club, but it lacks a true equivalent.

The macuahuitl was 3 to 4 feet (0.91 to 1.2 m) long, and three inches (80 mm) broad, with a groove along either edge, into which sharp-edged pieces of flint or obsidian were inserted, and firmly fixed with some adhesive compound. The rows of obsidian blades were sometimes discontinuous, leaving gaps along the side while at other times the rows were set close together and formed a single edge. The design of the macuahuitl allowed the warrior to injure the opponent with the obsidian blades while the blunt top could be used to render an individual unconscious for easy capture and later sacrifice.

The macuahuitl also has some drawbacks. It takes more time to lift and swing a club than it does to thrust with a sword. More space is needed as well, 

STATISTICS:
Special: Can kill with a single blow and sometimes knocks enemies unconscious
THACO:  +1 bonus
Damage:  1D8 +2
Damage type piercing
Weight: 7 
Speed Factor: 7
Type:  1-handed
Requires: 10 Strength
Macuahuitl

The "hungry-wood", is essentially a wooden sword with sharp prismatic obsidian blades embedded into its sides. A blow from such a weapon was reputedly capable of decapitating a horse. Although it is sometimes referred to as a sword or club, but it lacks a true equivalent.

The macuahuitl was 3 to 4 feet (0.91 to 1.2 m) long, and three inches (80 mm) broad, with a groove along either edge, into which sharp-edged pieces of flint or obsidian were inserted, and firmly fixed with some adhesive compound. The rows of obsidian blades were sometimes discontinuous, leaving gaps along the side while at other times the rows were set close together and formed a single edge. The design of the macuahuitl allowed the warrior to injure the opponent with the obsidian blades while the blunt top could be used to render an individual unconscious for easy capture and later sacrifice.

The macuahuitl also has some drawbacks. It takes more time to lift and swing a club than it does to thrust with a sword. More space is needed as well,

ZLIN204
Tepoztopilli
Tepoztopilli

The tepoztopilli was a pole-arm, roughly the height of a man, with a broad wooden head about twice the length of the users' palm or shorter, edged with razor-sharp obsidian blades which were deeply set in grooves carved into the head, and cemented in place with bitumen or plant resin as an adhesive. This made the weapon vaguely similar to the macuahuitl or "macana", however it had a much smaller cutting edge and a longer handle. This gave the weapon a superior reach, but blows had to be more carefully executed. Halfway between a halberd and a spear, the tepoztopilli was equally useful for slashing and thrusting. 

STATISTICS:
THACO:  +3 bonus
Damage:  1D10 +2
Damage type piercing
Weight: 7 
Speed Factor: 9
Type:  1-handed
Requires: 5 Strength
Tepoztopilli

The tepoztopilli was a pole-arm, roughly the height of a man, with a broad wooden head about twice the length of the users' palm or shorter, edged with razor-sharp obsidian blades which were deeply set in grooves carved into the head, and cemented in place with bitumen or plant resin as an adhesive. This made the weapon vaguely similar to the macuahuitl or "macana", however it had a much smaller cutting edge and a longer handle. This gave the weapon a superior reach, but blows had to be more carefully executed. Halfway between a halberd and a spear, the tepoztopilli was equally useful for slashing and thrusting.

ZLIN212
Green Dragon Crescent Blade
Green Dragon Crescent Blade

It has gone by many names, the Green dragon saber, black moon dragon, blue dragon moon, cresent glaive, and was copied in the making of the Yellow Dragon. It is also sometimes referred to as the Frost Fair Blade, from the idea that during a battle in the snow, the blade continuously had blood on it. The blood froze and made a layer of frost on the blade. The story of the blade was that the moment the blade was going to be forged by a blacksmith, there was a rising wind and gathering clouds and then suddenly 1780 drops of blood dripped from the air and a green dragon passed by. The dragon was cut up and the body became part of the components for the weapn, making it magical.

Little else is known about the weapon's origin besides the fact that it started out as a basic great blade that belonged to a courageous warrior by the name of Guan Yu. No one is quite sure on how it ended up in the tomb or how it was acquired, but it is said to be infused with the bones of the spirit beast. Supposedly, whoever holds it can feel the power from the creature within their hands, and also the spiritual courage of Guan Yu raging through their entire bodies during battle. The piercing force of the Green Dragon Crescent Blade is devastating to even the largest of opponents. Big or small, all will feel its sting and be brought to their humblest of states. Many have made the mistake of letting the power of the weapon consume them to the point where they feel invincible. Its legend is eternal, mortal man is not.

STATISTICS:
SPECIAL: +1 Strength
Armor Class Bonus: 1
THACO:  +5 bonus
Damage:  1D10 +4
Weight: 12 
Speed Factor: 7
Type:  2-handed
Green Dragon Crescent Blade

It has gone by many names, the Green dragon saber, black moon dragon, blue dragon moon, cresent glaive, and was copied in the making of the Yellow Dragon. It is also sometimes referred to as the Frost Fair Blade, from the idea that during a battle in the snow, the blade continuously had blood on it. The blood froze and made a layer of frost on the blade. The story of the blade was that the moment the blade was going to be forged by a blacksmith, there was a rising wind and gathering clouds and then suddenly 1780 drops of blood dripped from the air and a green dragon passed by. The dragon was cut up and the body became part of the components for the weapn, making it magical.

Little else is known about the weapon's origin besides the fact that it started out as a basic great blade that belonged to a courageous warrior by the name of Guan Yu. No one is quite sure on how it ended up in the tomb or how it was acquired, but it is said to be infused with the bones of the spirit beast. Supposedly, whoever holds it can feel the power from the creature within their hands, and also the spiritual courage of Guan Yu raging through their entire bodies during battle. ZLIN220
Ohnyalei
Ohnyalei

The staff magical staff of Merlin, Ohnyalei, whose name means spirit and grace, also later belonged to an eagleboy named Scree, with the ability to change between human form and that of an eagle. The staff has seven runes; A butterfly for the power of Changing, a cracked stone, for Protecting, a sword, for naming, a dragon's tail, for Eliminating, an eye for Seeing and a star and circle for Leaping.
Ohnyalei

The staff magical staff of Merlin, Ohnyalei, whose name means spirit and grace, also later belonged to an eagleboy named Scree, with the ability to change between human form and that of an eagle. The staff has seven runes; A butterfly for the power of Changing, a cracked stone, for Protecting, a sword, for naming, a dragon's tail, for Eliminating, an eye for Seeing and a star and circle for Leaping.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Jets de sauvegarde : +2

Capacités de charge : 
- Capacité 2 (12 fois par jour)
  Boule de feu
  Projectile magique (instantané)
- Capacité 3 (1 fois par jour)
  Piège à sorts (piège des sorts de niveau 9 ou moins, jusqu'à ce que 30 niveaux de sort aient été emprisonnés) pendant 8 heures

ZLIN222
Gae Bulg
Gae Bulg

The Gáe Bulg (also Gáe Bulga, Gáe Bolg, Gáe Bolga, , meaning "notched spear", "belly spear", "swelling spear", "bellows-dart", or possibly "lightning spear", was the spear of Cúchulainn. It was made from the bone of a sea monster, the Coinchenn, that had died while fighting another sea monster, the Curruid.
Gae Bulg

The Gáe Bulg (also Gáe Bulga, Gáe Bolg, Gáe Bolga, , meaning "notched spear", "belly spear", "swelling spear", "bellows-dart", or possibly "lightning spear", was the spear of Cúchulainn. It was made from the bone of a sea monster, the Coinchenn, that had died while fighting another sea monster, the Curruid.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Points de vie maximum : +10

- 51 % de chance d'infliger 2d4 points de dégâts de poison à la cible (jet de sauvegarde contre les souffles pour éviter)
- 26 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

A tomahawk (also referred to as a hawk) is a type of axe resembling a hatchet with a straight shaft.Tomahawks were general purpose tools used as a hand-to-hand or a thrown weapon, much like the nzappa zap. It originally featured a stone head, but later iron or brass heads were used. 
Spirit Tomahawk

A tomahawk (also referred to as a hawk) is a type of axe resembling a hatchet with a straight shaft.Tomahawks were general purpose tools used as a hand-to-hand or a thrown weapon, much like the nzappa zap. It originally featured a stone head, but later iron or brass heads were used.

ZLIN243
Dagger of Time
Dagger of Time

The Dagger of Time contains "charges" of the Sands of Time from the hourglass that enables the wielder to reverse, stop and slow time, as well as protect him/her from changes in the timeline or alteration by the Sands. 

The exact origin of The Dagger of Time is unknown, however, since the Sands of Time were created on the Island of Time it's likely the dagger was too. It was later stolen from the Island of Time by the Maharajah along with the Sands. The Dagger was placed in a glass case in the Mahajarah's treasury.
Dagger of Time

The Dagger of Time contains "charges" of the Sands of Time from the hourglass that enables the wielder to reverse, stop and slow time, as well as protect him/her from changes in the timeline or alteration by the Sands. 

The exact origin of The Dagger of Time is unknown, however, since the Sands of Time were created on the Island of Time it's likely the dagger was too. It was later stolen from the Island of Time by the Maharajah along with the Sands. The Dagger was placed in a glass case in the Mahajarah's treasury.

ZLIN244
Lion Sword
Lion Sword

The majestic lion with teeth bared, ready to roar, is given by the King upon an individual's completion of a term as Champion, either by holding the position until the next Champion's Tournament or by ascending the throne during their tenure as champion. . A lion's head is on both sides of this cast metal guard hilt, with a twisted minaret pommel accented with roaring lion embelishments.

Special: 

3/per day the sword can blend the user with his surroundings so that he becomes invisible. Equipping this also makes you immune to fear.

The majestic lion with teeth bared, ready to roar, is given by the King upon an individual's completion of a term as Champion, either by holding the position until the next Champion's Tournament or by ascending the throne during their tenure as champion. . A lion's head is on both sides of this cast metal guard hilt, with a twisted minaret pommel accented with roaring lion embelishments.

3/per day the sword can blend the user with his surroundings so that he becomes invisible. Equipping this also makes you immune to fear.

ZLIN245
Magical Golden Horseshoe
Magical Golden Horseshoe

A horseshoe is a U-shaped item made of metal or of modern synthetic materials, nailed or glued to the hooves of horses and some other draught animals. Like a shoe on a human, it is used to protect the animal's feet from wear and tear. Professional horseshoers, also called farriers or blacksmiths, attach horseshoes on the palmar surface of the hoof, usually by nailing through the insensitive hoof wall, which is anatomically similar to the human toenail, though much larger and thicker. 

Some horseshoes are crafted from magical elements and give small blessing to the people that wear them as amulets. Because the skill to make such fine items is rare, and components change a little in different regions, the magical benefits vary but such things are an art not science.
Magical Golden Horseshoe

A horseshoe is a U-shaped item made of metal or of modern synthetic materials, nailed or glued to the hooves of horses and some other draught animals. Like a shoe on a human, it is used to protect the animal's feet from wear and tear. Professional horseshoers, also called farriers or blacksmiths, attach horseshoes on the palmar surface of the hoof, usually by nailing through the insensitive hoof wall, which is anatomically similar to the human toenail, though much larger and thicker. 

Some horseshoes are crafted from magical elements and give small blessing to the people that wear them as amulets. Because the skill to make such fine items is rare, and components change a little in different regions, the magical benefits vary but such things are an art not science.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Jets de sauvegarde : +3 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons
- Facteur de vitesse : +1
- Constitution : +1
- Chance : +7
- Soigne 4 points de vie au porteur
- Bénédiction
- Détecte les pièges

Poids : 3


ZLIN246
Plasma Sword
Plasma Sword

Plasma Swords or Energy swords, were an ancient development in weaponry by some forgotten civilization consisting of a plasma charged blade powered by a power cell in the hilt, with a pair of velmorite crystals used for focusing. It will incinerate most projectiles such as arrows or bolts just by being drawn close to them, making the user invulnerable to missle weapons.
Plasma Sword

Plasma Swords or Energy swords, were an ancient development in weaponry by some forgotten civilization consisting of a plasma charged blade powered by a power cell in the hilt, with a pair of velmorite crystals used for focusing. It will incinerate most projectiles such as arrows or bolts just by being drawn close to them, making the user invulnerable to missle weapons.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1

- Inflige 1d2 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible
- 100 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible
- 91 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

ZLIN261
Sword of Omens
Sword of Omens

The Sword of Omens contains the mystic Eye of Thundera and is Lion-O's primary weapon. By default, it takes the form of a dagger resting within the Claw Shield on Lion-O's hip, but it grows into a fully-fledged sword as Lion-O produces the Thundercat Signal by swinging it around, saying "Thunder... Thunder... Thunder... Thundercats! HOOOOOOO!".

STATISTICS:

Damage:  1D8 +3
THAC0: +3
Damage type: slashing
Weight: 1

Special: The sword can shoot energy beams and produce a protective force field.

ZLIN263
Rapier of Inigo Montoya
Rapier of Inigo Montoya

When Inigo Montoya's father, Domingo, was asked by a nobleman, with a six-fingered right hand, Count Rugen, to forge a sword to accommodate his unusual grip, Domingo poured his heart and soul into the project. When Rugen returned, he reneged on his promised price. Thus Domingo refused to sell him the sword, not as a matter of money, but because Rugen could not appreciate the great work of the sword. He proclaimed that the sword would now belong to Inigo. Angered, Rugen killed Domingo. Ten-year-old Inigo witnessed the crime and challenged Rugen to a fight, wherein Rugen easily disarmed Inigo, spared his life and allowed him to keep the sword, but scarred his face as a deterrent to further displays of bravery.

Devastated by the loss of his father, Inigo devoted his entire life to becoming a great swordsman in order to avenge his father. His training started when he was 12 years old and included tutelage under the most skilled and savage fencing masters of his time. After 10 years of training, Inigo had become the greatest swordsman of his generation, and the only living man to hold the rank of "wizard" (a fictional fencing rank above "master"). His original elaborate fantasies of revenge eventually evolved into a simple greeting: "Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die." When he finally confronted Rugen, he repeated the line throughout the duel before at last avenging his father.

Special:
Protection against hold
Attack Speed Modifier: +1
Extra attack per round
Movement Modifer: +1
Rapier of Inigo Montoya

When Inigo Montoya's father, Domingo, was asked by a nobleman, with a six-fingered right hand, Count Rugen, to forge a sword to accommodate his unusual grip, Domingo poured his heart and soul into the project. When Rugen returned, he reneged on his promised price. Thus Domingo refused to sell him the sword, not as a matter of money, but because Rugen could not appreciate the great work of the sword. He proclaimed that the sword would now belong to Inigo. Angered, Rugen killed Domingo. Ten-year-old Inigo witnessed the crime and challenged Rugen to a fight, wherein Rugen easily disarmed Inigo, spared his life and allowed him to keep the sword, but scarred his face as a deterrent to further displays of bravery.

Devastated by the loss of his father, Inigo devoted his entire life to becoming a great swordsman in order to avenge his father. His training started when he was 12 years old and included tutelage under the most skilled and savage fencing masters of his time. After 10 years of training, Inigo had become the greatest swordsman of his generation, and the only living man to hold the rank of "wizard" (a fictional fencing rank above "master"). His original elaborate fantasies of revenge eventually evolved into a simple greeting: "Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die." When he finally confronted Rugen, he repeated the line throughout the duel before at last avenging his father.

Special:
Protection against hold
Attack Speed Modifier: +1
Extra attack per round
Movement Modifer: +1

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Facteur de vitesse : +2
- Attaque par round : +1
- Vitesse de déplacement : +1
- Immunité à la paralysie

Capacités de charge : 
- Hâte pendant 2 rounds (1 fois par jour)

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d6 +2
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 1
Type de compétence : Épée courte
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 2

ZLIN269

Leonardo's Katana

Although they are universally referred to as katana, these weapons are in fact Ninjato, also known as ninjaken or shinobigatana. The typical ninjato carried by a ninja would more likely have been a wakizashi short sword fitted with a katana-length handle and placed in a katana-length saya (scabbard)

ZLIN275
Tores
Tores

500 years ago, the Kingdom of Granville fought a terrible war with Darces the Dark Overlord. A great hero, the warrior "Magi", rose to challenge Darces. He owned six magical swords and a powerful suit of armor that was impervious to all but the most powerful of magic. Five of his six swords were Elemental blades, each created from the rarest metals on earth. The sixth blade, @829, used an even more powerful metal.

Using his powers, Magi defeated Darces, and exiled him to a far away land. After defeating Darces, Magi grew old and passed away.

Now, on a dark, stormy night in the Kingdom of Granville, Darces the Dark Overlord returns to the land.

According to an old saying,

    "When the shadowed veil returns to mask the midday sun
    The Fire of Serpents will rise again; Five shall become the One.
    The elements now heed his call, and hope is born alive;
    We will have our peace once more when One becomes the Five." 

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +1 bonus
Damage:  1D8 +1, + elemental damage
Damage type:  slashing
Weight: 4
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: Long Sword
Type:  1-handed
Not Usable By:
 Druid
 Cleric
 Mage
Tores

500 years ago, the Kingdom of Granville fought a terrible war with Darces the Dark Overlord. A great hero, the warrior "Magi", rose to challenge Darces. He owned six magical swords and a powerful suit of armor that was impervious to all but the most powerful of magic. Five of his six swords were Elemental blades, each created from the rarest metals on earth. The sixth blade, @829, used an even more powerful metal.

Using his powers, Magi defeated Darces, and exiled him to a far away land. After defeating Darces, Magi grew old and passed away.

Now, on a dark, stormy night in the Kingdom of Granville, Darces the Dark Overlord returns to the land.

According to an old saying,

    "When the shadowed veil returns to mask the midday sun
    The Fire of Serpents will rise again; Five shall become the One.
    The elements now heed his call, and hope is born alive;
    We will have our peace once more when One becomes the Five."

- Points de vie maximum : +10
- Constitution : +1
- Résistance au feu : +75 %
- Résistance au froid : +75 %
- Résistance à l'électricité : +75 %

- 76 % de chance d'infliger 1 points de dégâts de feu à la cible

ZLIN279
Tender Hands of Masamune
Tender Hands of Masamune

A legend tells of a test where Muramasa challenged his master, Masamune, to see who could make a finer sword. They both worked tirelessly and eventually, when both swords were finished, they decided to test the results. The contest was for each to suspend the blades in a small creek with the cutting edge facing the current. Muramasa's sword, the Juuchi Yosamu (10,000 Cold Nights) cut everything that passed its way; fish, leaves floating down the river, the very air which blew on it. Highly impressed with his pupil's work, Masamune lowered his sword, the Yawarakai-Te (Tender Hands), into the current and waited patiently. Not a leaf was cut, the fish swam right up to it, and the air hissed as it gently blew by the blade. After a while, Muramasa began to scoff at his master for his apparent lack of skill in the making of his sword. Smiling to himself, Masamune pulled up his sword, dried it, and sheathed it. All the while, Muramasa was heckling him for his sword's inability to cut anything. A monk, who had been watching the whole ordeal, walked over and bowed low to the two sword masters. He then began to explain what he had seen.

    "The first of the swords was by all accounts a fine sword, however it is a blood thirsty, evil blade, as it does not discriminate as to who or what it will cut. It may just as well be cutting down butterflies as severing heads. The second was by far the finer of the two, as it does not needlessly cut that which is innocent and undeserving." 

STATISTICS:

Damage:  1D10 +4
THAC0: +4
Damage type:  slashing
Proficiency Type: Katana
Speed Factor: 10
Weight: 3
Type:  1-handed
Combat Ability:

Casts Cure Medium Wounds on the weilder every time the weapon stikes an opponent.
Tender Hands of Masamune

A legend tells of a test where Muramasa challenged his master, Masamune, to see who could make a finer sword. They both worked tirelessly and eventually, when both swords were finished, they decided to test the results. The contest was for each to suspend the blades in a small creek with the cutting edge facing the current. Muramasa's sword, the Juuchi Yosamu (10,000 Cold Nights) cut everything that passed its way; fish, leaves floating down the river, the very air which blew on it. Highly impressed with his pupil's work, Masamune lowered his sword, the Yawarakai-Te (Tender Hands), into the current and waited patiently. Not a leaf was cut, the fish swam right up to it, and the air hissed as it gently blew by the blade. After a while, Muramasa began to scoff at his master for his apparent lack of skill in the making of his sword. Smiling to himself, Masamune pulled up his sword, dried it, and sheathed it. All the while, Muramasa was heckling him for his sword's inability to cut anything. A monk, who had been watching the whole ordeal, walked over and bowed low to the two sword masters. He then began to explain what he had seen.

    "The first of the swords was by all accounts a fine sword, however it is a blood thirsty, evil blade, as it does not discriminate as to who or what it will cut. It may just as well be cutting down butterflies as severing heads. The second was by far the finer of the two, as it does not needlessly cut that which is innocent and undeserving." 

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités de combat : 
- Lorsque le porteur est touché ; Lance le sort Soins des blessures moyennes sur le porteur de manière permanente

Enchantement : +7
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d10 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Katana
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 1

Nécessite : 
- Force : 6


ZLIN280
The EverSpoon
The EverSpoon

Also known as, "The Rusty spoon", it is the most holy relic that remains of the forgotten world of "Everspoon". It was an insane world where the mighty Spoonsingers, Spoon clerics and hearthy warriors fought against the clerics of the Spork n' fork. The most powerful members of the order of Spoonsingers included Diablorex, high master, Demigod, and wielder of the holy relic of the rusty spoon, Sliver, the high priest, Bonnie, the high Bard. They kept the EverSpoon from the clutches of evil for many years. Then one day a natural disaster destroyed the world of "Everspoon", sending it into the darkness of oblivion. Luckily the "The Rusty spoon" was saved/stolen from the temple before that happened and survived the the apocalyptic disaster.


STATISTICS:

Damage:  1D4 +4
THAC0: +4
Damage type:  piercing
Weight: 0
Speed Factor: 0 
Proficiency Type: Dagger
Type:  1-handed
Not Usable By:
 Cleric
Special:
???????????
The EverSpoon

Also known as, "The Rusty spoon", it is the most holy relic that remains of the forgotten world of "Everspoon". It was an insane world where the mighty Spoonsingers, Spoon clerics and hearthy warriors fought against the clerics of the Spork n' fork. The most powerful members of the order of Spoonsingers included Diablorex, high master, Demigod, and wielder of the holy relic of the rusty spoon, Sliver, the high priest, Bonnie, the high Bard. They kept the EverSpoon from the clutches of evil for many years. Then one day a natural disaster destroyed the world of "Everspoon", sending it into the darkness of oblivion. Luckily the "The Rusty spoon" was saved/stolen from the temple before that happened and survived the the apocalyptic disaster.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +1
- Jets de sauvegarde : +1 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons
- Attaque par round : +1
- Régénère 1 point de vie toutes les 4 secondes
- Force : +2
- Résistance au feu : +50 %
- Immunité aux poisons
- Immunité à la paralysie
- Téléporte aléatoirement le porteur auprès d'un ennemi à portée de vue, toutes les 7 secondes

Capacités de combat : 
- Provoque l'échec des sorts profanes incantés par la cible pendant 5 secondes
- 91 % de chance d'étourdir la cible pendant 4 secondes
- 76 % de chance d'infliger 1d2 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible
- 76 % de chance d'infliger 1d2 points de dégâts de froid magique à la cible
- 76 % de chance d'infliger confusion à la cible pendant 10 secondes
- 76 % de chance Inverse le sexe de la cible pendant 25 secondes

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d4 +4
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 0

ZLIN283
Conan's Father's Sword
Conan's Father's Sword

This is the sword that Conan used to avenge his mother and father's death by cutting off the head of Thulsa Doom. There is an etch along the blade that reads "Suffer no guilt yee who wield this in the name of Crom". The handle is leather wrapped and is embraced with a cast steel pommel and hilt. Although it can now only be used functionally as a dagger after it was broken in half by Conan's Atlantean Sword while Conan battled Rexor, the weapon is still teeming with the ancient aura of the mighty barbarian.

ZLIN291
Gladiator Gladius of Maximus
Gladiator Gladius of Maximus

"My name is Maximus Decimus Meridius, Commander of the Armies of the North, General of the Felix Legions, loyal servant to the true emperor, Marcus Aurelius. Father to a murdered son, husband to a murdered wife. And I will have my vengeance, in this life or the next."

-Maximus Decimus Meridius, Gladiator.

Used by General Maximus Decimus Meridius during his time as a gladiator. The blade of the sword is  stainless steel double edged and contains twin blood grooves down the center. The handle is ivory with a golden medallion in the middle of the grip with a leather wrap and strapping. The ball pommel is beautifully decorated with golden leaves enclosing the dark wood.
Gladiator Gladius of Maximus

ZLIN294
Blade Runner Shinobi Sword
Blade Runner Shinobi Sword

The cut-throat chrome-look blade, made of 440 stainless steel with a sharpened edge and a serrated back edge, is balanced, stylish and truly unique with a jet black perforated handle. The sword has emphasized holes all through the handle for swiftness. The scabbard conceals a tanto dagger. Overall length is 40" long, the sword is 37.5" long, and the blade is 26" long, the dagger is 6.5" long.

Amulets are usually magical devices that are commonly worn around the neck, suspended from a chain.  The type of chain that comes with an amulet generally increases the item's aesthetic value, not its magical properties.  Only one amulet can be dangled from the neck at a time.

When obtained, it is suggested to be just as evil as Majora's Mask. Many believe that Fierce Deity is Majora's nemesis and that Majora gave Link the mask in order to defeat the hero as well as the spirit inhabiting the mask at the same time. 


All of the masks sold by the Happy Mask Salesman come with a stamp of approval and a warranty that clearly states that any mask broken while questing shall not be covered by the Happy Mask Salesman.

Rapier of The Four Musketeers

These are the weapons used by the famed Four Musketeers, d'Artagnan, Athos, Porthos, and Aramis. The basket hilt on each weapon is ambidextrous and a very effective mix of both the cup-hilt and swept-hilt styles. The grip is wood wrapped with twisted wire, and the guard is plated with gleaming nickel silver.

ZLIN306
Bow of Ullyses
Bow of Ullyses

This was the bow which Ulysses left when he went for Troy. Legend has it that only Ulysses could draw his bow, and once shot an arrow through twelve rings. By this sign Penelope recognised her husband after an absence of twenty years. 

Ulysses' bow was also said to be prophetic. It belonged at one time to Eurytus of Echalia. “This bow of mine sang to me of present war ... `I have heard but once of such a weapon ... the bow of Odysseus,' said the queen.”
Bow of Ullyses

This was the bow which Ulysses left when he went for Troy. Legend has it that only Ulysses could draw his bow, and once shot an arrow through twelve rings. By this sign Penelope recognised her husband after an absence of twenty years. 

Ulysses' bow was also said to be prophetic. It belonged at one time to Eurytus of Echalia. “This bow of mine sang to me of present war ... `I have heard but once of such a weapon ... the bow of Odysseus,' said the queen.”

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Attaque par round : Passe à une demi

ZLIN314
Mistilteinn
Mistilteinn 

Mistilteinn first belonged to Þráinn, who had been king in Valland before he retired in his burial mound with his wealth. When King Óláfr and his men, among whom Hrómundr Gripsson, learnt about that and found the barrow. Þráinn, who had become a draugr, the living dead, was sitting inside. No one but Hrómundr dared to enter. After a long and fierce fight, he defeated Þráinn and took his treasure, especially his sword, with which Þráinn had killed four hundred and twenty men, including King Semingr.

Hrómundr used Mistilteinn during the battle between Óláfr and two kings both named Haldingr. He killed Helgi inn frækni, the Valiant, who had slain his brothers. He then lost Mistilteinn in the water out of witchcraft. He deeply felt this loss but soon recovered his sword, which was found in the stomach of a pike.
Mistilteinn 

Mistilteinn first belonged to Þráinn, who had been king in Valland before he retired in his burial mound with his wealth. When King Óláfr and his men, among whom Hrómundr Gripsson, learnt about that and found the barrow. Þráinn, who had become a draugr, the living dead, was sitting inside. No one but Hrómundr dared to enter. After a long and fierce fight, he defeated Þráinn and took his treasure, especially his sword, with which Þráinn had killed four hundred and twenty men, including King Semingr.

Hrómundr used Mistilteinn during the battle between Óláfr and two kings both named Haldingr. He killed Helgi inn frækni, the Valiant, who had slain his brothers. He then lost Mistilteinn in the water out of witchcraft. He deeply felt this loss but soon recovered his sword, which was found in the stomach of a pike.

Capacités de charge : 
- Réduit la cible au silence pendant 1 tour (jet de sauvegarde à -5 contre les sorts pour éviter) (3 fois par jour)

Enchantement : +2
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d8 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 3
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 3

Nécessite : 
- Force : 6

ZLIN328
Sword of Truth
Sword of Truth

The Sword of Truth is a sword that is carried by the Seeker of Truth. The sword has the power to cut through anything perceived as the enemy while not harming a friend. The only exception to this was a sword forged from 100 bloody tips of the armory of the Palace of the Prophets. The Sword of Truth draws on the rage of the one wielding it, but can be turned white and, when used with love and forgiveness, can slay even a friend. However, only the true Seeker can turn the blade of the Sword of Truth white.

In order to use the blade, the wielder must be able to release their anger. If they are not able to release their anger the sword will still work but the price may be their life. The Sword of Truth gives the Seeker a test of pain the first time the Seeker kills with the sword. After many years of usage, the sword wears the Seeker down and eventually turns the wielder into a shadow (or monster) of him/her former self. Only the true Seeker, the one who can turn the blade white, will not wear down in this fashion and remain as he/she is. 

  
Damage: 1d6 +4 Slashing Damage
Thac0 Bonus: +2
Special: 
  10 times a day Detect Evil.
  4d4 Magic Damage
  Does an extra 10  damage to ALL Evil.
Equipped Effects:
  33% Magic Resistance Bonus
  Immune to poison and disease.
  +3 to saving throws
  +5 to AC
  +1 attack per round.
Speed: 0
Weight: 5
Use: 2-Handed
Proficiency: Bastard Sword
Required Stats: 14 Strength, 16 Wis, 9 Int.
Usable By:
 Paladin
 Fighter
 Ranger
 Good Alignment

The Sword of Truth is a sword that is carried by the Seeker of Truth. The sword has the power to cut through anything perceived as the enemy while not harming a friend. The only exception to this was a sword forged from 100 bloody tips of the armory of the Palace of the Prophets. The Sword of Truth draws on the rage of the one wielding it, but can be turned white and, when used with love and forgiveness, can slay even a friend. However, only the true Seeker can turn the blade of the Sword of Truth white.

In order to use the blade, the wielder must be able to release their anger. If they are not able to release their anger the sword will still work but the price may be their life. The Sword of Truth gives the Seeker a test of pain the first time the Seeker kills with the sword. After many years of usage, the sword wears the Seeker down and eventually turns the wielder into a shadow (or monster) of him/her former self. ZLIN337
Tyrfing
Tyrfing

Svafrlami  was the king of Gardariki, and Odin's grandson. He managed to trap the Dwarves  Dvalinn  and Durin when they had left the rock where they dwelt, and forced them to forge a sword with a golden hilt that would never miss a stroke, would never rust and would cut through stone and iron as easily as through clothes. The Dwarves made the sword, and it shone and gleamed like fire. However, in revenge they cursed it so that it would kill a man every time it was drawn and that it would be the cause of three great evils. They finally cursed it so that it would also kill Svafrlami himself. When Svafrlami heard the curses he tried to slay Dvalin, but the Dwarf disappeared into the rock and the sword was driven deep into it, though missing its victim. Svafrlami was killed by the berserker  Arngrim  who took the sword in his turn. After Arngrim, it was worn by Angantyr  and his eleven brothers. They were all slain at Samsø, by the champion Hjalmar, and his sworn brother Orvar-Odd; but Hjalmar, being wounded by Tyrfing, has only time to sing his death-song before he dies, and asks Orvar-Odd to bring his body to Ingeborg  at Uppsala. Angantyr's daughter, Hervor (by his wife Tofa) is brought up as a bond-maid, in ignorance of her parentage. When at last she learns it, she arms herself as a shieldmaiden, and goes to Munarvoe in Samsø, in quest of the dwarf-cursed weapon. She finds it and marries Hofund. They have two sons, Heidrek and Angantyr. Hervor secretly gave her son the sword Tyrfing. While Angantyr and Heidrek walked, Heidrek wanted to have a look at the sword. Since he had unsheathed it, the curse the Dwarves had put on the sword made Heidrek kill his brother Angantyr. Heidrek became king of the Goths. During a voyage, Heidrek camped at the Carpathians (Harvaða fjöllum, cf. Grimm's law). He was accompanied by eight mounted thralls, and when Heidrek slept at night, the thralls broke into his tent and took Tyrfing and slew Heidrek. This was the last one of Tyrfing's three evil deeds. Heidrek's son Angantyr  caught the thralls, killed them and reclaimed the magic sword, and the curse had ceased.
Tyrfing

Svafrlami  was the king of Gardariki, and Odin's grandson. He managed to trap the Dwarves  Dvalinn  and Durin when they had left the rock where they dwelt, and forced them to forge a sword with a golden hilt that would never miss a stroke, would never rust and would cut through stone and iron as easily as through clothes. The Dwarves made the sword, and it shone and gleamed like fire. However, in revenge they cursed it so that it would kill a man every time it was drawn and that it would be the cause of three great evils. They finally cursed it so that it would also kill Svafrlami himself. When Svafrlami heard the curses he tried to slay Dvalin, but the Dwarf disappeared into the rock and the sword was driven deep into it, though missing its victim. Svafrlami was killed by the berserker  Arngrim  who took the sword in his turn. After Arngrim, it was worn by Angantyr  and his eleven brothers. They were all slain at Samsø, by the champion Hjalmar, and his sworn brother Orvar-Odd; but Hjalmar, being wounded by Tyrfing, has only time to sing his death-song before he dies, and asks Orvar-Odd to bring his body to Ingeborg  at Uppsala. Angantyr's daughter, Hervor (by his wife Tofa) is brought up as a bond-maid, in ignorance of her parentage. When at last she learns it, she arms herself as a shieldmaiden, and goes to Munarvoe in Samsø, in quest of the dwarf-cursed weapon. She finds it and marries Hofund. They have two sons, Heidrek and Angantyr. Hervor secretly gave her son the sword Tyrfing. While Angantyr and Heidrek walked, Heidrek wanted to have a look at the sword. Since he had unsheathed it, the curse the Dwarves had put on the sword made Heidrek kill his brother Angantyr. Heidrek became king of the Goths. During a voyage, Heidrek camped at the Carpathians (Harvaða fjöllum, cf. Grimm's law). He was accompanied by eight mounted thralls, and when Heidrek slept at night, the thralls broke into his tent and took Tyrfing and slew Heidrek. This was the last one of Tyrfing's three evil deeds. Heidrek's son Angantyr  caught the thralls, killed them and reclaimed the magic sword, and the curse had ceased.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Maudit : Ne peut être ôté qu'à l'aide d'un sort de Délivrance de la malédiction
- Inflige 5 points de dégâts tranchants au porteur
- Niveau : -1 de manière permanente
- Points de vie maximum : +4
- Points de vie maximum : +20
- Force : +1
- Résistance à la magie : +35 %
- Résistance au froid : +50 %
- Immunité au sort Confusion
- Immunité au sort Labyrinthe psionique
- Immunité au sort Domination
- Immunité au sort Coup de fouet à l'ego
- Immunité au sort Attaque balistique
- Immunité au sort Détonation
- Immunité au sort Souffle psionique
- Immunité au sort Domination psionique
- Immunité à la confusion
- Immunité au drain de niveaux
- 21 % de chance de tuer instantanément le porteur

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts magiques à la cible
- Points de vie maximum : +4 pendant 1 tour
- Dissipe tous les sorts de protection de niveau 7 ou moins sur la cible de manière permanente
- Dissipe 1 sort d'attaque divinatoire de niveau 9 ou moins sur la cible
- 51 % de chance de paralyser les créatures pendant 3 rounds (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
- 26 % de chance de tuer instantanément la cible (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 6 % de chance d'infliger 20 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +5
Dégâts : 1d10 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 3
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 8

Nécessite : 
- Force : 14
- Charisme : 5


ZLIN338
The Sword of Shannara
The Sword of Shannara

During the Second War of the Races, the sword was forged by Urprox Screl at the behest of Bremen. Rumored to be the finest smith in all the Southland, Screl put that to the test during the forging, and with aid from an Old World formula provided by the outcast Cogline and the magic of the Druid Bremen he managed to forge it. The Eilt Druin medallion was fused into the hilt, and the truth of Druids past was infused within the weapon. The sword's power confronts any who touch it with the absolute truth about themselves.
The Sword of Shannara

During the Second War of the Races, the sword was forged by Urprox Screl at the behest of Bremen. Rumored to be the finest smith in all the Southland, Screl put that to the test during the forging, and with aid from an Old World formula provided by the outcast Cogline and the magic of the Druid Bremen he managed to forge it. The Eilt Druin medallion was fused into the hilt, and the truth of Druids past was infused within the weapon. The sword's power confronts any who touch it with the absolute truth about themselves.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Immunité à la confusion
- Immunité aux charmes

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +3
Dégâts : 1d10 +3
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Épée à deux mains
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 10

Nécessite : 
- Force : 14


ZLIN339
The Black Sword
The Black Sword

This weapon was made using the Forge of Virtue, created by the mage Erethian. The weapon, made of blackrock was one of the few that could hurt the dragon named Dracothraxus. After being trapping in a gem on the sword, a demon named Arcadion remembers Dracothraxus from a previous encounter and kills the dragon.

SPECIAL:
Creates a fire field
The Black Sword

This weapon was made using the Forge of Virtue, created by the mage Erethian. The weapon, made of blackrock was one of the few that could hurt the dragon named Dracothraxus. After being trapping in a gem on the sword, a demon named Arcadion remembers Dracothraxus from a previous encounter and kills the dragon.

SPECIAL:
Creates a fire field

Capacités de combat : 
- Bouclier de feu (rouge) (instantané) pendant 125 secondes

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d10 +2
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 8
Type de compétence : Épée à deux mains

Poids : 10

- Force : 14


ZLIN340
Grayswandir
Grayswandir

Grayswandir, also known as the Night Blade, is the sword of Corwin, one of the 'Nine Princes in Amber'. Its twin is Brand's Werewindle, the Day Sword. Both Grayswandir and Werewindle are inscribed with portions of the Pattern of Amber; this makes them particularly effective against creatures of Chaos. In addition, Grayswandir has one magical property that makes it particularly useful: Corwin can call it by creating a Shadow where he wills it to exist. Unlike a normal blade, Grayswandir can also harm apparitions, and allows Corwin to speak to the shades in Tir-na Nog'th.
Grayswandir

Grayswandir, also known as the Night Blade, is the sword of Corwin, one of the 'Nine Princes in Amber'. Its twin is Brand's Werewindle, the Day Sword. Both Grayswandir and Werewindle are inscribed with portions of the Pattern of Amber; this makes them particularly effective against creatures of Chaos. In addition, Grayswandir has one magical property that makes it particularly useful: Corwin can call it by creating a Shadow where he wills it to exist. Unlike a normal blade, Grayswandir can also harm apparitions, and allows Corwin to speak to the shades in Tir-na Nog'th.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Régénère 1 point de vie toutes les 6 secondes

Capacités de combat : 
- 76 % de chance d'infliger 1d4 points de dégâts de froid à la cible

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d6 +2
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2

ZLIN347
Eternal Sword
Eternal Sword

The Eternal Sword is a legendary sword, capable of cleaving the fabric of time and space itself. The Eternal Sword was created by Origin, the King of Summon Spirits, at the request of Mithos Yggdrasill, who held a pact with him at the time. Mithos used the Eternal Sword to split the world in two halves, placing each world in separate dimensions tied to each other, via the mana links, in order to prevent the world's destruction. Because the sword was made specifically for Mithos, only those of elven blood can wield it. 
Eternal Sword

The Eternal Sword is a legendary sword, capable of cleaving the fabric of time and space itself. The Eternal Sword was created by Origin, the King of Summon Spirits, at the request of Mithos Yggdrasill, who held a pact with him at the time. Mithos used the Eternal Sword to split the world in two halves, placing each world in separate dimensions tied to each other, via the mana links, in order to prevent the world's destruction. Because the sword was made specifically for Mithos, only those of elven blood can wield it. 

Capacités de charge : 
- Arrêt du temps (1 fois par jour)

TAC0 : +3

ZLIN348
Albion Sword of Robin Hood
Albion Sword of Robin Hood

It was entrusted to Robin of Loxley by Herne the Hunter, with the words: "It is Albion. One of the Seven Swords of Wayland the Smith. Charged by him with the powers of light and darkness." Legend has it, that centuries before Robin Hood called this weapon his own, it belonged to the avatar of Beelzebub, Lord of the Flies.

ZLIN349
Xena's Chakram
Xena's Chakram

Given to her by Ares, who stole it from the gods, this razor-sharp metal ring covered in custom gold and silver with several mother of pearl ornamental pieces fixed into the weapon, conveniently returns to its owner after being hurled at an enemy. The ring doesn’t have to be thrown, it can also serve as a very effective weapon for close range hand-to-hand combat as well. It is lethal at approximately 50 yards, and can cause significant damage at up to 100 yards. Xena could use it at great distances and often caused it to ricochet off surfaces, armours or helmets to incapacitate multiple enemies before returning it to her hand. One time she threw it in such a way that it spun in mid-air, and sawed through a nearby tree branch.
Xena's Chakram

Given to her by Ares, who stole it from the gods, this razor-sharp metal ring covered in custom gold and silver with several mother of pearl ornamental pieces fixed into the weapon, conveniently returns to its owner after being hurled at an enemy. The ring doesn’t have to be thrown, it can also serve as a very effective weapon for close range hand-to-hand combat as well. It is lethal at approximately 50 yards, and can cause significant damage at up to 100 yards. Xena could use it at great distances and often caused it to ricochet off surfaces, armours or helmets to incapacitate multiple enemies before returning it to her hand. One time she threw it in such a way that it spun in mid-air, and sawed through a nearby tree branch.

ZLIN350
Dragonslicer
Dragonslicer

The Sword of Heroes, as Dragonslicer is known, is certainly one of the least-feared Swords... one of those least feared by humans, that is. To face Dragonslicer in combat is simply to face a Sword of exceptional quality yet no real magic. Its magic is very specialized, but it has a power rarely seen elsewhere in the world of the Swords -- the ability to slice dragon scales (and other parts) as if they were the hide (and flesh) of a much lesser, non-magical reptile -- and this, in addition to its other "talent", makes the wielder a natural for slaying dragons, but gives no edge when fending off anything else. These limitations to its usefulness keep Dragonslicer from being in great demand among the more power-hungry. If they can acquire it, so much the better, but what have kings and armies to fear from the Sword of Heroes? 
Dragonslicer

The Sword of Heroes, as Dragonslicer is known, is certainly one of the least-feared Swords... one of those least feared by humans, that is. To face Dragonslicer in combat is simply to face a Sword of exceptional quality yet no real magic. Its magic is very specialized, but it has a power rarely seen elsewhere in the world of the Swords -- the ability to slice dragon scales (and other parts) as if they were the hide (and flesh) of a much lesser, non-magical reptile -- and this, in addition to its other "talent", makes the wielder a natural for slaying dragons, but gives no edge when fending off anything else. These limitations to its usefulness keep Dragonslicer from being in great demand among the more power-hungry. If they can acquire it, so much the better, but what have kings and armies to fear from the Sword of Heroes? 

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d8 +2 points de dégâts tranchants contre les dragons
- Inflige 1d25 points de dégâts contre les dragons argentés de manière permanente
- Inflige 1d25 points de dégâts contre les dragons rouges de manière permanente
- Inflige 1d25 points de dégâts contre les dragons noirs de manière permanente

Enchantement : +6
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d1 +1
Type de dégâts : Contondant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 2

Nécessite : 
- Force : 5


ZLIN351
Keyblade
Keyblade

As the name implies, in combat, Keyblades are used in a manner similar to swords. Despite the fact that most possess no actual blade, Keyblades still make efficient combat weapons. The origins of the Keyblades is, thus far, unclear. The special qualities of the wielders are given vague explanation of the Keyblades' power, but none have shown where the Keyblades originated, how they are created, or what their original purpose might have been. One legend mentioned in Kingdom Hearts states that the Keyblade master saved the world, while another said he wrought chaos and destruction upon it. While these legends may appear to contradict themselves, it can be assumed that the Keyblade master chooses how to use the Keyblade, whether for good or evil. The Keyblades are known throughout the worlds as a unique and powerful weapons. In Atlantica, King Triton and Ursula both knew of the Keyblades and their powers. King Triton did not want Sora to seal the Keyhole because he thought that the Keyblade would send his world into chaos, while Ursula knew that it gave the ability for the one who wields it to travel around the worlds. All Keyblades shown have the same distinguishing features that are modeled after a key: a guard with a handle, a hilt and a blade with some type of a "sharp point" that gives it a cutting ability, which comes from the grooves and teeth of a real key.
Keyblade

As the name implies, in combat, Keyblades are used in a manner similar to swords. Despite the fact that most possess no actual blade, Keyblades still make efficient combat weapons. The origins of the Keyblades is, thus far, unclear. The special qualities of the wielders are given vague explanation of the Keyblades' power, but none have shown where the Keyblades originated, how they are created, or what their original purpose might have been. One legend mentioned in Kingdom Hearts states that the Keyblade master saved the world, while another said he wrought chaos and destruction upon it. While these legends may appear to contradict themselves, it can be assumed that the Keyblade master chooses how to use the Keyblade, whether for good or evil. The Keyblades are known throughout the worlds as a unique and powerful weapons. In Atlantica, King Triton and Ursula both knew of the Keyblades and their powers. King Triton did not want Sora to seal the Keyhole because he thought that the Keyblade would send his world into chaos, while Ursula knew that it gave the ability for the one who wields it to travel around the worlds. All Keyblades shown have the same distinguishing features that are modeled after a key: a guard with a handle, a hilt and a blade with some type of a "sharp point" that gives it a cutting ability, which comes from the grooves and teeth of a real key.

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d4 +4
Facteur de vitesse : 0
Type de compétence : Épée courte
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0


ZLIN352
Althena's Sword
Althena's Sword

Althena's Sword is a legendary item said to contain the essence of the Goddess Althena  herself. Whether this means that Althena actually used the sword as a weapon is unknown. Traditionally, the sword is wielded by the Dragonmaster, although the sword ceased to be used after the events of Silver Star Story. After the events thereof, Alex entrusted the blade to Nall and Nall was never able to find another person worthy of wielding the blade.
Althena's Sword

Althena's Sword is a legendary item said to contain the essence of the Goddess Althena  herself. Whether this means that Althena actually used the sword as a weapon is unknown. Traditionally, the sword is wielded by the Dragonmaster, although the sword ceased to be used after the events of Silver Star Story. After the events thereof, Alex entrusted the blade to Nall and Nall was never able to find another person worthy of wielding the blade.

Enchantement : +3
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d8 +2
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 0
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

ZLIN353
Zodiac sword
Zodiac sword

The Zodiac Sword is an incarnation of the Night Rune, one of the 27 true runes. It has power over beings of night. In the original Gensou Suikoden the Zodiac sword appears in the castle adjacent to Qlon temple in the western Senan area of the Scarlet Moon empire. It is located by Viktor in his attempt to destroy Neclord, who was presently terrorizing the Lorimar region, more specifically, the Warrior's Village. With the Zodiac Sword's help, Viktor removed the magic barrier that shielded Neclord from physical attacks and eventually ran him through. After this, Viktor continued using the Zodiac sword through the remainder of the Gate Rune War.
Zodiac sword

The Zodiac Sword is an incarnation of the Night Rune, one of the 27 true runes. It has power over beings of night. In the original Gensou Suikoden the Zodiac sword appears in the castle adjacent to Qlon temple in the western Senan area of the Scarlet Moon empire. It is located by Viktor in his attempt to destroy Neclord, who was presently terrorizing the Lorimar region, more specifically, the Warrior's Village. With the Zodiac Sword's help, Viktor removed the magic barrier that shielded Neclord from physical attacks and eventually ran him through. After this, Viktor continued using the Zodiac sword through the remainder of the Gate Rune War.

- TAC0 : +1 contre les morts-vivants
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts contondants au porteur
