ZLIN383
Soul Caliber
Soul Caliber

Soul Calibur is the spirit sword created to combat Soul Edge. Algol, the king that once wielded Soul Edge and lost his son because of the demonic sword, vowed to create a holy sword from the purified shards of Soul Edge that would oppose the evil sword, being its equal in strength and opposite in intent. Algol enlisted the help of the greatest sage in the land, who used purified fragments of the cursed sword to forge a new spirit sword, to be known as "Soul Calibur". After many failed attempts, the holy sword was born when Algol sacrificed himself to complete the ritual. However, the sword that was created was far from good due to Algol's thirst for power, and it was extremely similar in nature to Soul Edge. Nonetheless, the tribe that was tasked with guarding the sword slowly purified it to the point that it could be considered a holy weapon, while keeping dormant the dark soul that rested within the sword. The guardians lived in seclusion, passing the sword from generation to generation in secret. Whenever a warrior vowed to take on Soul Edge on his own, Soul Calibur appeared to prevent the cursed sword from causing any more damage. Soul Calibur finally appeared, somehow transformed into a different shape, as one of the Ling-Sheng Su Temple treasures.
Soul Caliber

Soul Calibur is the spirit sword created to combat Soul Edge. Algol, the king that once wielded Soul Edge and lost his son because of the demonic sword, vowed to create a holy sword from the purified shards of Soul Edge that would oppose the evil sword, being its equal in strength and opposite in intent. Algol enlisted the help of the greatest sage in the land, who used purified fragments of the cursed sword to forge a new spirit sword, to be known as "Soul Calibur". After many failed attempts, the holy sword was born when Algol sacrificed himself to complete the ritual. However, the sword that was created was far from good due to Algol's thirst for power, and it was extremely similar in nature to Soul Edge. Nonetheless, the tribe that was tasked with guarding the sword slowly purified it to the point that it could be considered a holy weapon, while keeping dormant the dark soul that rested within the sword. The guardians lived in seclusion, passing the sword from generation to generation in secret. Whenever a warrior vowed to take on Soul Edge on his own, Soul Calibur appeared to prevent the cursed sword from causing any more damage. Soul Calibur finally appeared, somehow transformed into a different shape, as one of the Ling-Sheng Su Temple treasures.

Enchantement : +7
TAC0 : +2
Dégâts : 1d10 +2
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Katana
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 4

Nécessite : 
- Force : 6


ZLIN384
Staff of Nurgle
Staff of Nurgle

Nurgle is the Chaos god of death and destruction, personified by stagnation, entropy, disease and decay. Nurgle is depicted as a large hulking figure covered in oozing sores and vivid marks of decay. His power is said to come from the mortal races' reaction to the inevitability of death and disease. This is his favorite staff.
Staff of Nurgle

Nurgle is the Chaos god of death and destruction, personified by stagnation, entropy, disease and decay. Nurgle is depicted as a large hulking figure covered in oozing sores and vivid marks of decay. His power is said to come from the mortal races' reaction to the inevitability of death and disease. This is his favorite staff.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Maudit : Ne peut être ôté qu'à l'aide d'un sort de Délivrance de la malédiction
- Empoisonne le porteur et lui inflige 1 point de dégâts par seconde pendant 10 secondes (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- Inocule une maladie qui inflige 1 point de dégâts de poison par seconde au porteur pendant 10 secondes (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- Niveau : -4 de manière permanente
- Constitution : -4
- Lenteur pendant 45 secondes
- 11 % de chance de tuer instantanément le porteur (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Capacités de combat (au corps à corps) : 
- Empoisonne la cible et lui inflige 1 point de dégâts par seconde pendant 10 secondes (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- Inocule une maladie qui inflige 1 point de dégâts de poison par seconde à la cible pendant 10 secondes (jet de sauvegarde contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)

Capacités de combat : 
- Convocation d'insectes

ZLIN400
Conan's Atlantean Sword
Conan's Atlantean Sword

After being set free by his master, Conan discovered a sword that once belonged to an ancient Atlantean king in a tomb. The beauty of this sword is due to its roughness, its details, and its finishing and meticulous dedication to craftsmanship which are appreciated at the smelting and handle with the human skull, at the double head serpent at the bronze finished metal alloy cross guard, at the wrapped grip with a lubricated rustic rope, which enriches its majestic blade engraved with deep original runes.

Features:
Overall Length: 40 7/8'' Blade: 30 1/8''
Weight: 7.8 Lbs
Conan's Atlantean Sword

After being set free by his master, Conan discovered a sword that once belonged to an ancient Atlantean king in a tomb. The beauty of this sword is due to its roughness, its details, and its finishing and meticulous dedication to craftsmanship which are appreciated at the smelting and handle with the human skull, at the double head serpent at the bronze finished metal alloy cross guard, at the wrapped grip with a lubricated rustic rope, which enriches its majestic blade engraved with deep original runes.

ZLINK1
Master Sword
The Master Sword, Bastard Sword +4

  Also known as the "The Blade of Evil's Bane",  the Master Sword has the power to "repel evil", which enables it to overcome powerful dark magic and evil beings. It was forged by the Sages of Hyrule by order of the three goddesses just before the Imprisoning War.
  The blade cross-section is hexagonal with no fuller. On the flats of the blade near the hilt is a Triforce symbol, etched into the steel in gold. It has a blue and purple curved crossguard in the shape of a pair of wings with a small yellow jewel where it meets the hilt. The hilt is padded red with a non-ornate blue pommel.
  The sword can only be wielded by a descendant of the Knights of Hyrule. In fact, only a Hylian Elf who carries their bloodline is capable of fighting with this weapon.
  Pulled from an altar hidden deep within the Lost Woods by the Sages led by Sahasrahla, it was moved to an even more protected hiding place; deep within the vaults and dungeons of the Temple of Time until another one worthy of its powers could be found.
  Indeed, no evil can stand its sight nor stain its sharp blade; darkness scurries from its touch and even the most powerful of daemons with the blackest of hearts can be struck with it. Because of its magical ability to repel evil, the sword also allows its wielder to face untold evils without fear of them or their powers.
  The sword also doubles as a key to the Sacred Realm, and can be used to time-travel

STATISTICS:

Equipped Effects:
  Immunity to Fear, Horror & a Failure of Morale
  Protection from Evil
  +2 AC bonus
  +2 to all Saving Throws

Combat Effects:
  Dispells Magic on any successful strike
  +6 damage vs. undead, shapeshifters, & all extra-planar beings (demons, planetars, etc.) & to chaotic evil opponents
  Can shoot blasts of magical energy for 1d4 damage
THACO:  +4 bonus
Damage:  2D4+4
Damage type: slashing
Weight: 3
Speed Factor: 2
Proficiency Type: Bastard Sword
Type: 1-handed
Requires: 12 Strength & 16 Dexterity
Usable By:
Elves & Half-Elves Fighters (or some derivasion there-of) of Lawful or Neutral Allignment
The Master Sword, Bastard Sword +4

  Also known as the "The Blade of Evil's Bane",  the Master Sword has the power to "repel evil", which enables it to overcome powerful dark magic and evil beings. It was forged by the Sages of Hyrule by order of the three goddesses just before the Imprisoning War.
  The blade cross-section is hexagonal with no fuller. On the flats of the blade near the hilt is a Triforce symbol, etched into the steel in gold. It has a blue and purple curved crossguard in the shape of a pair of wings with a small yellow jewel where it meets the hilt. The hilt is padded red with a non-ornate blue pommel.
  The sword can only be wielded by a descendant of the Knights of Hyrule. In fact, only a Hylian Elf who carries their bloodline is capable of fighting with this weapon.
  Pulled from an altar hidden deep within the Lost Woods by the Sages led by Sahasrahla, it was moved to an even more protected hiding place; deep within the vaults and dungeons of the Temple of Time until another one worthy of its powers could be found.
  Indeed, no evil can stand its sight nor stain its sharp blade; darkness scurries from its touch and even the most powerful of daemons with the blackest of hearts can be struck with it. Because of its magical ability to repel evil, the sword also allows its wielder to face untold evils without fear of them or their powers.
  The sword also doubles as a key to the Sacred Realm, and can be used to time-travel

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Jets de sauvegarde : +2
- Immunité à l'horreur
- Immunité à la peur
- Immunité à la confusion

Capacités de combat (au corps à corps) : 
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les rakshasas
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les loups-garous
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les dopplegangers
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les morts-vivants
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les démons
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les créatures chaotiques mauvaises

Enchantement : +9
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 2d4 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2

Capacités de combat (au corps à corps) : 
- Dissipation de la magie assurée sur la cible

Enchantement : +9
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 2d4 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2

Capacités de combat (à distance) : 
- Revient dans la main du lanceur
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les rakshasas
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les loups-garous
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les dopplegangers
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les morts-vivants
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les démons
- Inflige 4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les créatures chaotiques mauvaises
- Inflige 1d4 +1 points de dégâts magiques à la cible

TAC0 : +4
Type de dégâts : Perforant
Facteur de vitesse : 0

Type de compétence : Épée bâtarde
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 3

- Force : 12
- Dextérité : 16

- 26 % de chance d'infliger Horreur au porteur pendant 75 secondes (jet de sauvegarde contre les souffles pour éviter)
- 26 % de chance d'infliger Débilité mentale au porteur pendant 100 secondes (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour éviter)
- 1 % de chance d'augmenter de +50 les points de vie maximum du porteur

ZLINK21
Excalibanana
Excalibanana

This yellow-hued sword is legendary among the native people of Frosgard. They claim that it was the weapon used by Eric the Unready, who it seemed was never prepared for battle. It is supposed to have surfaced from a lake when Eric cried out, "Yoohoo!". It is said that whoever wields this weapon wonders why they bought it in the first place.

ZLINK25
Golden Girdle of Gaea 
Golden Girdle of Gaea 

when the Themyscirian Amazons were created by the Olympian gods, they assigned Hippolyta and Antiope to rule as co-queens to the new nation. They gave each of the Amazon queens a Golden Girdle of Gaea, which were made from the original girdle belonging to the Earth goddess. The belts provided the two queens with enhanced strength and heightened their other abilities.

Eventually the demi-god Heracles was successful in stealing Hippolyta's belt at the urging of his half-brother Ares. After denouncing the Olympian gods for perceived false judgement, Antiope gave Hippolyta her girdle and left the Amazon nation with a group of faithful Amazons. They later retrieved Hippolyta's stolen belt from Theseus, one of Hercules' companions, and kept it as an heirloom until it was lost for good later on.

STATISTICS:

Strength set to 25
Weight:  2
Not usable by:
Golden Girdle of Gaea 

when the Themyscirian Amazons were created by the Olympian gods, they assigned Hippolyta and Antiope to rule as co-queens to the new nation. They gave each of the Amazon queens a Golden Girdle of Gaea, which were made from the original girdle belonging to the Earth goddess. The belts provided the two queens with enhanced strength and heightened their other abilities.

Eventually the demi-god Heracles was successful in stealing Hippolyta's belt at the urging of his half-brother Ares. After denouncing the Olympian gods for perceived false judgement, Antiope gave Hippolyta her girdle and left the Amazon nation with a group of faithful Amazons. They later retrieved Hippolyta's stolen belt from Theseus, one of Hercules' companions, and kept it as an heirloom until it was lost for good later on.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Force : Passe à 25

Poids : 2

ZLINK31
Robin Hood's Bow
Robin Hood's Bow

Robin Of Locksley or Robin Hood as he was better known, was a legendary hero known for "robbing the rich to give to the poor" while fighting against injustice and tyranny with his band of Merry Men. He was a master archer and won several tournaments and fair ladies by using this bow. It is of exceptional quality, made with an ancient yew and is of such quality that it never needs to be restrung or tightened, even after getting wet. The draw of the bow is feather light for extreme accuracy and speed.

Weight: 2

ZLINK33
Caliburn
Caliburn

Given to Arthur by the Lady in the Lake in return for a favor to be named later, Caliburn, or as it is more commonly known in chronicle circles, Excalibur, is the magical sword which gave Arthur the power to unite the kingdoms. Its origins are as misty as the location of Avalon, but it is clear that the weapon was forged by some supernatural being in order to assist worthy kings in defending justice.

Type: slashing
Speed Factor: 2
Proficiency: long sword
Special: 10% of death of target with a save vs. death at -4.
Usuable: 
lawful good fighters, rangers and paladins with a minimum of 18 strength.

Draupnir
Draupnir

Forged by the dwarven brothers Brokkr and Eitri, Draupnir is a golden arm ring possessed by Odin. The ring was placed by Odin on the funeral pyre of his son Baldr. The ring was subsequently retrieved by Hermoor and was offered as a gift by Freyr's servant Skírnir in the wooing of Geror. The ring is a source of endless wealth.

ZLINK54
Shield of Achilles
Shield of Achilles

This is the shield that Achilles used in his fight with Hector. It was forged by the god Hephaestus at the request of Achilles'mother, the Nereid Thetis.


Homer gives a detailed description of the imagery that decorates the new shield.

-The Earth, sky and sea, the sun, the moon and the constellations

-"Two beautiful cities full of people": in one a wedding and a law case are taking place the other city is besieged by one feuding army and the shield shows an ambush and a battle. 

-A field being ploughed for the third time

-A king's estate where the harvest is being reaped

-A vineyard with grape pickers

-A "herd of straight-horned cattle"; the lead bull has been attacked by a pair of savage lions which the herdsmen and their dogs are trying to beat off

-A picture of a sheep farm

-A dancing-floor where young men and women are dancing

-The great stream of Ocean 

STATISTICS:

Armor Class Bonus: 2
Special:  +4 Against Missles
Weight: 2
Requires: 12 Strength
Not Usable By:
 Bard
 Druid
 Mage
 Thief

Homer gives a detailed description of the imagery that decorates the new shield.

-The Earth, sky and sea, the sun, the moon and the constellations

-"Two beautiful cities full of people": in one a wedding and a law case are taking place the other city is besieged by one feuding army and the shield shows an ambush and a battle.

-A king's estate where the harvest is being reaped

-A vineyard with grape pickers

-A picture of a sheep farm

Four-Leaf Clover

The four-leaf clover is an uncommon variation of the common, three-leaved clover. According to tradition, they bring good luck to their finders, especially if found accidentally. It has been estimated that there are approximately 10,000 three-leaf clovers for every four-leaf clover.
Four-Leaf Clover

The four-leaf clover is an uncommon variation of the common, three-leaved clover. According to tradition, they bring good luck to their finders, especially if found accidentally. It has been estimated that there are approximately 10,000 three-leaf clovers for every four-leaf clover.

ZLINK62
William Tell's Crossbow
William Tell's Crossbow

William Tell was known as an expert marksman with the crossbow. The ruling monarchy raised a pole in the village's central square, and hung a hat on top of it, demanding that all the local townsfolk bow before the hat. When Tell passed by the hat without bowing to it, he was arrested. He received the punishment of being forced to shoot an apple off the head of his son, Walter, or else both would be executed. Tell had been promised freedom if he successfully shot the apple. He split the fruit with a single bolt from his crossbow, without mishap.
William Tell's Crossbow

William Tell was known as an expert marksman with the crossbow. The ruling monarchy raised a pole in the village's central square, and hung a hat on top of it, demanding that all the local townsfolk bow before the hat. When Tell passed by the hat without bowing to it, he was arrested. He received the punishment of being forced to shoot an apple off the head of his son, Walter, or else both would be executed. Tell had been promised freedom if he successfully shot the apple. He split the fruit with a single bolt from his crossbow, without mishap.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- TAC0 des armes à projectiles : +4
- Attaque par round : Passe à 3
- Vitesse de déplacement : -95 %

Dégâts : +2
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 1
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 2 mains

Poids : 2


ZLINK63

The Goddess Athena became bored with her monotonous life in Olympus and desired exciting adventures. One day she opened the Door Which Should Not Be Opened in the basement of Castle Victory, and fell into another world called Fantasy World which was dominated by an evil emperor Dante. This is the hammer she used to vanquish him.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Inflige 8 points de dégâts contondants au porteur
- Points de vie maximum : +5
- Force : +2
- Sagesse : +5

Capacités de combat (à distance) : 
- Revient dans la main du lanceur
- Inflige 1d4 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible

Capacités de combat (au corps à corps) : 
- Inflige 10 points de dégâts d'électricité à la cible

Enchantement : +6
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 2d4 +4
Type de dégâts : Projectile
Facteur de vitesse : 1
Type de compétence : Marteau de guerre
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 4

Nécessite : 
- Force : 9


ZLINK65
Rygar's Diskarmor
Rygar's Diskarmor

Resembling a shield with spikes attached to its sides, the Diskarmor is swung on a chain so that Rygar can hit enemies from far away. The Diskarmor has more than 30 different moves, and can be used to do everything from throw an enemy into another enemy for a two-in-one kill or act as a pseudo-grappling hook for traveling across gaps
Rygar's Diskarmor

Resembling a shield with spikes attached to its sides, the Diskarmor is swung on a chain so that Rygar can hit enemies from far away. The Diskarmor has more than 30 different moves, and can be used to do everything from throw an enemy into another enemy for a two-in-one kill or act as a pseudo-grappling hook for traveling across gaps

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Classe d'armure : +2
- Résistance aux dégâts tranchants : +1 %
- Résistance aux dégâts contondants : +1 %
- Résistance aux dégâts perforants : +2 %

- Renvoie les sorts de dégâts offensif
- Renvoie les éclairs

- Inflige 2d6 points de dégâts magiques à la cible

ZLINK66
Demon Sword
Demon Sword

The legend goes that an evil demon ruled over the world and its inhabitants. However, a man named Victar, who came from a small village, had found a sword that could destroy the demon. The blade had previously been split up into pieces, though, and Victar had to travel through three worlds to get back the three missing pieces to restore the sword to defeat the demon. This is the fully completed version of the weapon.

Special: Causes miscast magic or horror on successful hits.
Demon Sword

The legend goes that an evil demon ruled over the world and its inhabitants. However, a man named Victar, who came from a small village, had found a sword that could destroy the demon. The blade had previously been split up into pieces, though, and Victar had to travel through three worlds to get back the three missing pieces to restore the sword to defeat the demon. This is the fully completed version of the weapon.

Special: Causes miscast magic or horror on successful hits.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- Maudit : Ne peut être ôté qu'à l'aide d'un sort de Délivrance de la malédiction
- Résistance au feu : +100 %

Capacités de combat : 
- Inflige 1d12 points de dégâts de feu à la cible
- Provoque l'échec de 80 % des sorts profanes incantés par la cible pendant 100 secondes (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre les sorts pour éviter)
- Provoque l'échec de 80 % des sorts divins incantés par la cible pendant 100 secondes (jet de sauvegarde à -2 contre les sorts pour éviter)
- Inflige Horreur à la cible pendant 3 rounds (jet de sauvegarde à +2 contre les sorts pour éviter)

Enchantement : +4
TAC0 : +6
Dégâts : 1d6 +6
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 0


ZLINK67
Golden Axe of of Yuria
Golden Axe of of Yuria

This axe is the magical emblem of the people of Yuria. It was stolen by Death Adder, who planned to destroy both the axe and the royal family unless the people of Yuria accepted him as their ruler.
The people were saved by three heroes, a battle axe-wielding dwarf named Gilius Thunderhead, a long-sword-wielding amazon named Tyris Flare, and a male barbarian named Ax Battler. 

The heroes first saved the inhabitants of the ransacked Turtle Village, which was situated on the shell of a giant turtle. They rode the turtle across the sea, and then flew to castle on the back of a giant eagle. Once at the castle they battled Death Adder, who was wielding the Golden Axe. At the end of the battle Death Adder was knocked down and was killed by his own weapon. The King and his daughter were freed from their captivity and the people were once again safe from tyranny. This is that legedary axe.

STATISTICS:

THAC0: +2 bonus
Damage:  1D8 +2
Damage type:  slashing
Weight: 5
Speed Factor: 5
Proficiency Type: Axe
Type:  1-handed
Requires: 17 Strength
Not Usable By:
 Druid
 Cleric
 Mage 
 Thief
Golden Axe of of Yuria

This axe is the magical emblem of the people of Yuria. It was stolen by Death Adder, who planned to destroy both the axe and the royal family unless the people of Yuria accepted him as their ruler.
The people were saved by three heroes, a battle axe-wielding dwarf named Gilius Thunderhead, a long-sword-wielding amazon named Tyris Flare, and a male barbarian named Ax Battler. 

The heroes first saved the inhabitants of the ransacked Turtle Village, which was situated on the shell of a giant turtle. They rode the turtle across the sea, and then flew to castle on the back of a giant eagle. Once at the castle they battled Death Adder, who was wielding the Golden Axe. At the end of the battle Death Adder was knocked down and was killed by his own weapon. The King and his daughter were freed from their captivity and the people were once again safe from tyranny. This is that legedary axe.

PARAMÈTRES :

- Points de vie maximum : +10
- Constitution : +2

ZLINK68
Iron Sword of Kuros
Iron Sword of Kuros

Long ago in the distant Kingdom of Elrond, an evil wizard named Malkil kidanapped eight maidens including the kingdom's princess. However the legendary hero Kuros, saved the maidens and defeated Malkil. The evil wizard vowed revenge, and shortly after his defeat, he took control of the four elementals of the world, wind, water, fire and earth, and began to wreak havoc upon the kingdom. The kigdom became a dark place. It was then that Kuros found the four pieces of the legendary Iron Sword and reassembled the blade. With it he defeated Malkil in an epic final battle on Icefire Mountain and restored peace in the kingdom of Elrond.

SPECIAL: 
slays elementals on contact (save vs. death at -6 or be destroyed.)
Iron Sword of Kuros

Long ago in the distant Kingdom of Elrond, an evil wizard named Malkil kidanapped eight maidens including the kingdom's princess. However the legendary hero Kuros, saved the maidens and defeated Malkil. The evil wizard vowed revenge, and shortly after his defeat, he took control of the four elementals of the world, wind, water, fire and earth, and began to wreak havoc upon the kingdom. The kigdom became a dark place. It was then that Kuros found the four pieces of the legendary Iron Sword and reassembled the blade. With it he defeated Malkil in an epic final battle on Icefire Mountain and restored peace in the kingdom of Elrond.

SPECIAL: 
slays elementals on contact (save vs. death at -6 or be destroyed.)

Capacités de combat : 
- Soigne 5 points de vie au porteur de manière permanente
- Tue instantanément les élémentaires de terre (jet de sauvegarde à -6 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- Tue instantanément les élémentaires de feu (jet de sauvegarde à -6 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- Tue instantanément les élémentaires d'air (jet de sauvegarde à -6 contre la paralysie, la mort et les poisons pour éviter)
- 26 % de chance d'infliger 1d4 points de dégâts de feu à la cible
- 26 % de chance d'infliger 1d4 +1 points de dégâts de froid à la cible

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d10 +8
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

ZLINK72
Power Sword of Eternia
Power Sword of Eternia

Sometimes also referred to as the Sword of Power, the Sword of Grayskull, or King Grayskull's Sword of Power. The sword was once split in two halves and were hidden: one at Eternia's "highest point", the other beneath its "hardest rock". The "highest point" turns out to be the top of Stratos's mountain, while the "hardest rock" is the rock where He-Man built his home. It was then stored in Castle Grayskull until the day it was claimed by Prince Adam. This sword contained the very essence of King Grayskull's noble attributes and strengths, and allows its wielder to call upon those same gifts.
Power Sword of Eternia

Sometimes also referred to as the Sword of Power, the Sword of Grayskull, or King Grayskull's Sword of Power. The sword was once split in two halves and were hidden: one at Eternia's "highest point", the other beneath its "hardest rock". The "highest point" turns out to be the top of Stratos's mountain, while the "hardest rock" is the rock where He-Man built his home. It was then stored in Castle Grayskull until the day it was claimed by Prince Adam. This sword contained the very essence of King Grayskull's noble attributes and strengths, and allows its wielder to call upon those same gifts.

Capacités d'équipement : 
- TAC0 : +7 de manière permanente
- Immunité au drain de niveaux
- Renvoie jusque 5 sorts de niveau 9
- Renvoie jusque 5 sorts de niveau 8
- Renvoie jusque 5 sorts de niveau 7
- Renvoie jusque 25 sorts de niveau 1
- Renvoie jusque 20 sorts de niveau 2
- Renvoie jusque 20 sorts de niveau 3
- Renvoie jusque 10 sorts de niveau 4
- Renvoie jusque 10 sorts de niveau 6
- Renvoie jusque 10 sorts de niveau 5
- 51 % de chance de renvoyer les éclairs
- 51 % de chance de renvoyer les projectiles magiques
- 26 % de chance de renvoyer les sorts de dégâts offensif

Capacités de charge : 
- Capacité 2 (3 fois par jour)
  Augmente de 10 la force de la cible pendant 3 heures
  Force de champion pendant 3 heures
  Force d'un seul pendant 3 heures
  Puiser dans la puissance divine pendant 3 heures

Enchantement : +7
TAC0 : +12
Dégâts : 1d20 +5
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 1

Nécessite : 
- Force : 10
- Charisme : 7

Arkista's Ring
Arkista's Ring

The Elven ring of Arkista was stolen by the evil Shogun, who has cast the entire Elven Kingdom into darkness. The only hope for the Elves was Christine, their most famous warrior. Equipped with only a bow, she traveled through a hundred and twenty five different levels, defeated Shogun and retrieved the ring. The powers of the ring remain mysterious, but it a symbol of freedom for the Elven Kingdom.
Arkista's Ring

The Elven ring of Arkista was stolen by the evil Shogun, who has cast the entire Elven Kingdom into darkness. The only hope for the Elves was Christine, their most famous warrior. Equipped with only a bow, she traveled through a hundred and twenty five different levels, defeated Shogun and retrieved the ring. The powers of the ring remain mysterious, but it a symbol of freedom for the Elven Kingdom.

ZLINK78
Magic Telescope
Magic Telescope:
While the physics behind a telescope have been well-known for some time, the glass-grinding skills required to actually construct one are still quite specialized. The lenses of this telescope are finely made, and its collapsible tubing has obviously been crafted by a master well-versed in the delicate art of jewel-setting and metalwork. This telescope has been imbued with magical properties.

STATISTICS:
Saving Throws: +1 Bonus
Armor Class: +1 Bonus
Thaco: +1 bonus
Weilder Can cast:
Clairvoyance.
Usable Only By
Mage (single,dual,multi-class)
Neutral & Good Aligned.

ZLINK84
Crystalis
Crystalis

With the help of a girl named Mesia, and assisted by the four sages, Zebu, Tornel, Asina, and Kensu, the legendary nameless hero took the four elemental Swords of Wind, Fire, Water, and Thunder and combined them to forge the Crystalis in order to fight against the tyrannical Draygonia Empire. With the weapon in hand, the hero vanquished Draygonia's Finest Four, General Kelbesque, Sabera the Witch, Mado the Warrior, and Karmine the Wizard, and then traveled to a desert pyramid and confronted Emperor Draygon himself. After defeating the villian, the hero entered the "Floating Tower" and defeated it's mechanical mind, disabling the tower and allowing humanity another chance.

STATISTICS:

Damage:  1D12+4
Special: 20% chance of +3 fire, electricity, acid, poison or cold damage
THACO:  +5
Weight: 3
Speed Factor: 3
Proficiency Type: Long Sword
Type:  1-handed
Requires: 14 Strength
Crystalis

With the help of a girl named Mesia, and assisted by the four sages, Zebu, Tornel, Asina, and Kensu, the legendary nameless hero took the four elemental Swords of Wind, Fire, Water, and Thunder and combined them to forge the Crystalis in order to fight against the tyrannical Draygonia Empire. With the weapon in hand, the hero vanquished Draygonia's Finest Four, General Kelbesque, Sabera the Witch, Mado the Warrior, and Karmine the Wizard, and then traveled to a desert pyramid and confronted Emperor Draygon himself. After defeating the villian, the hero entered the "Floating Tower" and defeated it's mechanical mind, disabling the tower and allowing humanity another chance.

ZLINK85
Muramasa's 10,000 Cold Nights
Muramasa's 10,000 Cold Nights

Legend tells of a test where an ancient swordsmith named Muramasa challenged his master, Masamune, to see who could make a finer sword. They both worked tirelessly and eventually, both swords were finished. Muramasa's sword, the Juuchi Yosamu (10,000 Cold Nights) cut everything was rumored to be able to cut anything that passed its way.

Damage:  1D12 + 3
THACO:  +4 bonus
Damage type:  slashing
Weight: 2
Speed Factor: 1
Special Abilities:
50% chance of 1d4 of cold damage on each hit.
Muramasa's 10,000 Cold Nights

Legend tells of a test where an ancient swordsmith named Muramasa challenged his master, Masamune, to see who could make a finer sword. They both worked tirelessly and eventually, both swords were finished. Muramasa's sword, the Juuchi Yosamu (10,000 Cold Nights) cut everything was rumored to be able to cut anything that passed its way.

PARAMÈTRES : 

Capacités de combat : 
- 51 % de chance d'infliger 1d6 points de dégâts de froid à la cible

Enchantement : +5
TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 1d12 +3
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 1
Type de compétence : Katana
Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 2

Nécessite : 
- Force : 17
- Dextérité : 16


ZLINK86
Durendal
Durendal

Also known as the "Stone-Master" and the "durable scimitar/scythe", it once belonged to Hector of Troy, and was given to Charlemagne's paladin, Count Roland by Malagigi. This sword is said to contain within its golden hilt one tooth of Saint Peter, the blood of Saint Basil, the hair of Saint Denis, and a piece of the raiment of the Blessed Virgin Mary. Count Roland attempts to destroy the sword to prevent it from being captured by the ambushing Saracens but Durendal proves indestructible, so he hides it beneath his body along with the oliphant, the horn used to alert Charlemagne.


STATISTICS:

Damage:  1D8 + 2
THACO:  +2 bonus
Damage type:  slashing
Weight: 2
Speed Factor: 1
Special Abilities:
 Protection from evil 10' radius
 50% Magic Resistance
 The user will be blessed while equipped
 +2 strength 
Proficiency Type: Large Sword
Type:  1-handed

Also known as the "Stone-Master" and the "durable scimitar/scythe", it once belonged to Hector of Troy, and was given to Charlemagne's paladin, Count Roland by Malagigi. ZLINK92
Aegis Shield
Aegis Shield

The aegis, as stated in the Iliad, is the shield of Pallas Athena or Zeus, which according to Homer was fashioned by Hephaestus. Athena lent the Aegis to the legendary hero Perseus, to battle the dreaded Medusa. A Gorgon with steely scales and snakes for hair, Medusa was so frightening to behold that those who viewed her directly turned to stone. Perseus slew Medusa by watching her reflection in the Aegis’ polished surface. Forever after, the shield also became adorned with four snakes in place of the gold tassels, representing fear, flight, force and pursuit, again enhancing the shield’s mystic impenetrable powers.

STATISTICS:

Armor Class Bonus:  +4
Special:

The Aegis protects against Stone, Poison, Silence and Stun.

Reduces magic damage and improves your Magic Resistance Modifier.
Aegis Shield

The aegis, as stated in the Iliad, is the shield of Pallas Athena or Zeus, which according to Homer was fashioned by Hephaestus. Athena lent the Aegis to the legendary hero Perseus, to battle the dreaded Medusa. A Gorgon with steely scales and snakes for hair, Medusa was so frightening to behold that those who viewed her directly turned to stone. Perseus slew Medusa by watching her reflection in the Aegis’ polished surface. Forever after, the shield also became adorned with four snakes in place of the gold tassels, representing fear, flight, force and pursuit, again enhancing the shield’s mystic impenetrable powers.

Staff of the Monkey King

The "Ruyi Jingu Bang", literally meaning "As-you-will Golden-bound Cudgel" is the name of this magical weapon, once wielded by the powerful Monkey King, Sun Wukong. Also named the 'Monkey King Bar', it shrinks and grows, changing sizes when used during battle and temporarily stuns opponents.

ZZ36DGD
Songe du dieu mort +4, +6 contre le bien
Le Songe du Dieu Mort
L'histoire de l'ascension de Baine, Bhaal et Myrkul, dieux respectifs de la haine et des querelles, du meurtre et de la mort, est connue par nombre d'érudits dans tout Féérûne. Malgré cela, les théologiens n'ont que peu d'informations quant à ce qui est arrivé au malheureux dieu perdu anéanti par le trio avant leur rencontre avec Jergal. On sait seulement qu'une infime partie de son essence réussit à rejoindre le Plan Astral, où elle se cristallisa pour former un minerai divin. Des centaines d'années plus tard, Merdros l'enchanteur trouva cet étrange minerai. Les serviteurs duergars de Medros s'en servirent pour faire une épée, qu'ils donnèrent à l'allié guerrier le plus puissant du magicien. Tous ceux qui par la suite ont manié l'épée ont déclaré pouvoir ressentir les dernières pensées du Dieu Mort.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités de charge :
- Émotion, peur trois fois par jour (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour annuler)
  Portée : 15 mètres
  Durée : 5 rounds
  Zone d'effet : rayon de 2,4 mètres

- Symbole de douleur une fois par jour
  -2 à la dextérité, -4 au TAC0 et -2 à la classe d'armure (jet de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour annuler)
  Portée : 10,5 mètres
  Durée : 11 tours
  Zone d'effet : rayon de 4,5 mètres

TAC0 : +4, +6 contre les créatures d'alignement bon
Dégâts : 2d4 +4, +5 contre les créatures d'alignement bon
Type de dégâts : tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : épée longue
Type : arme à une main
Nécessite : 6 en force

Poids : 4
Le Songe du Dieu Mort
L'histoire de l'ascension de Baine, Bhaal et Myrkul, dieux respectifs de la haine et des querelles, du meurtre et de la mort, est connue par nombre d'érudits dans tout Féérûne. Malgré cela, les théologiens n'ont que peu d'informations quant à ce qui est arrivé au malheureux dieu perdu anéanti par le trio avant leur rencontre avec Jergal. On sait seulement qu'une infime partie de son essence réussit à rejoindre le Plan Astral, où elle se cristallisa pour former un minerai divin. Des centaines d'années plus tard, Merdros l'enchanteur trouva cet étrange minerai. Les serviteurs duergars de Medros s'en servirent pour faire une épée, qu'ils donnèrent à l'allié guerrier le plus puissant du magicien. - Symbole : Douleur (1 fois par jour)

TAC0 : +4
Dégâts : 2d4 +4
Type de dégâts : Tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 2
Type de compétence : Épée longue
Type : Arme à 1 main

ZZC8HB
Enfer de Baine
L'Enfer de Baine
Cette superbe épée large est de facture assez spéciale : la lame a été réalisée dans un métal noir opaque d'origine inconnu, mais le tranchant semble être d'argent pur. Des runes d'un rouge flamboyant ont été gravées sur toute la longueur de la lame. La poignée et la garde ont été sculptées dans un rubis de belle taille. Cette arme est redoutable contre les créatures des plans inférieurs. Elle inflige des dégâts doublés aux Baatezu et aux Tanar'ri et donne à celui qui l'utilise un bonus +4 au toucher et aux dégâts. De plus, cette arme protège également du feu.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- résistance au feu : +20%

TAC0 : +4 contre les Baatezu et les Tanar'ri
Dégâts : 1d8, 2d8 +4 contre les Baatezu et les Tanar'ri
Type de dégâts : tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 5
Type de compétence : épée longue
Type : arme à une main
Nécessite : 6 en force

Poids : 5
L'Enfer de Baine
Cette superbe épée large est de facture assez spéciale : la lame a été réalisée dans un métal noir opaque d'origine inconnu, mais le tranchant semble être d'argent pur. Des runes d'un rouge flamboyant ont été gravées sur toute la longueur de la lame. La poignée et la garde ont été sculptées dans un rubis de belle taille. Cette arme est redoutable contre les créatures des plans inférieurs. Elle inflige des dégâts doublés aux Baatezu et aux Tanar'ri et donne à celui qui l'utilise un bonus +4 au toucher et aux dégâts. De plus, cette arme protège également du feu.

- Enchantement : +4 contre les démons
- TAC0 : +4 contre les démons
- Résistance au feu : +20 %

- Inflige 1d8 +4 points de dégâts tranchants contre les démons

Type : Arme à 1 main

Poids : 5

Nécessite : 
- Force : 6


ZZD5WOH
Vent du paradis +4, +5 contre les élémentaires
Le Vent du Paradis
Créé par un sorcier djinn très puissant sur le Plan Élémentaire de l'Air, le Vent du Paradis fut ensuite offert au Calife de Tamjuhk, qui le considéra alors comme la plus belle arme qu'il ait jamais eue en sa possession. Lorsque, plus tard, Tamjuhk fut saccagée par des éfrits, githyankis, salamandres et autres créatures malveillantes, l'éfrit Amir Talmed ramena l'arme au Grand Sultan de la Cité d'Airain. Un peu plus tard, le Vent du Paradis échut à Memnon, l'éfrit qui partit combattre le djinn Calim pour le contrôle de ce qui est aujourd'hui le Calimshan. Memnon ne l'utilisa que très peu et daigna même la laisser à son plus puissant lieutenant. Lorsque Memnon et Calim furent battus par la haute-magie elfe, leurs serviteurs prirent la fuite ou furent reconduits jusqu'à leur plan d'origine. On dit que, après la guerre épique, le Vent du Paradis retourna vers le djinn qui l'avait créé.

PARAMÈTRES :

Capacités d'équipement :
- immunité aux sorts de Nuage Mortel, Brume Mortelle, Nuage Puant, Nuage de Pestilence et Brume Corrosive de Malavon.

Dégâts : 1d8 +4, +5 contre les élémentaires
TAC0 : +4, +5 contre les élémentaires
Type de dégâts : tranchant
Facteur de vitesse : 1
Type de compétence : cimeterre / wakizashi / ninjatō
Type : arme à une main
Nécessite : 8 en force

Poids : 4
Le Vent du Paradis
Créé par un sorcier djinn très puissant sur le Plan Élémentaire de l'Air, le Vent du Paradis fut ensuite offert au Calife de Tamjuhk, qui le considéra alors comme la plus belle arme qu'il ait jamais eue en sa possession. Lorsque, plus tard, Tamjuhk fut saccagée par des éfrits, githyankis, salamandres et autres créatures malveillantes, l'éfrit Amir Talmed ramena l'arme au Grand Sultan de la Cité d'Airain. Un peu plus tard, le Vent du Paradis échut à Memnon, l'éfrit qui partit combattre le djinn Calim pour le contrôle de ce qui est aujourd'hui le Calimshan. Memnon ne l'utilisa que très peu et daigna même la laisser à son plus puissant lieutenant. Lorsque Memnon et Calim furent battus par la haute-magie elfe, leurs serviteurs prirent la fuite ou furent reconduits jusqu'à leur plan d'origine. On dit que, après la guerre épique, le Vent du Paradis retourna vers le djinn qui l'avait créé.

PARAMÈTRES :

- Immunité au sort Nuage de pestilence
- Immunité au sort Nuage puant
- Immunité au sort Brume mortelle
- Immunité au sort Nuage mortel
- Enchantement : +5 contre les élémentaires
- TAC0 : +1 contre les élémentaires
- Inflige 1 points de dégâts contre les élémentaires
